ingredients: Mutton Pieces: Mutton pieces 680g, Salt 1 tsp + ¼ tsp (for taste adjustment), Lime juice 1 tsp, Black pepper ½ tsp, Paprika or Kashmiri red chili powder 1 tsp + 1 tsp, Turmeric powder ¼ tsp + ¼ tsp, Ginger paste 1 tsp + 1 tsp, Garlic paste 1½ tsp + 1 tsp, Cooking oil 1 tsp + 2½ tbsp, Unsalted butter 1½ tsp, Cumin seeds 1 tsp, Green cardamom (bruised) 3, Black cardamom (bruised) 2, Cinnamon sticks (small) 3, Bay leaves 2, Onion (thinly sliced) 1¼ cups, Tomato (chopped) ½ cup, Green chilies (slit) 3 + 4 (whole), Mace blade 1, Water 2 cups + 3½ cups, Yogurt ¼ cup, Sugar ½ tsp, Coriander powder 1½ tsp, Roasted cumin powder 1 tsp, Garam masala 1 tsp,For Rice: Basmati rice (soaked for 30 min) 2 cups, Chopped coriander leaves 2 tbsp, Mint leaves 8-10, Cardamom powder ¼ tsp,For Garnish: Fried onions (beresta) 2 tbsp, Ghee 1 tsp
instructions:
Marinate Mutton: Combine mutton with 1 tsp salt, lime juice, ½ tsp pepper, 1 tsp paprika, ¼ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1½ tsp garlic paste, and 1 tsp oil. Set aside.

Prepare Spices: In a pot, heat 2½ tbsp oil and 1½ tsp butter. Add cumin seeds, green and black cardamom, cinnamon, and fry for 30-40 seconds. Add bay leaves, onions, and a pinch of salt, sautéing until light brown. Stir in 1 tsp each of ginger and garlic paste.

Cook Tomatoes & Spices: Add chopped tomato, 1 tsp Kashmiri red chili, ¼ tsp turmeric, ¼ tsp salt, and 3 slit green chilies. Mix well.

Cook Mutton: Add marinated mutton, sear on high heat for 2 minutes, then cover and sweat for 2 minutes on medium heat. Add mace blade and sauté for 6 minutes on medium-high heat.

Simmer Mutton: After mutton releases oil, add 2 cups water, yogurt, and ½ tsp sugar. Bring to a boil, add ½ tsp salt, cover, and simmer for 40-50 minutes until tender.

Add Spices & Rice: Add 3½ cups hot water, coriander powder, roasted cumin, and garam masala. Cook for 6 minutes. Remove visible garam masala, adjust seasoning, then add soaked rice, coriander, mint leaves, 4 whole green chilies, and ¼ tsp cardamom powder.

Final Cooking: Bring to a boil, then cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.

Garnish & Rest: Top with fried onions and 1 tsp ghee. Fluff the rice, cover, and rest for 10 minutes off the heat.

name: Egg Korma
ingredients:
1 cup diced onion,3 green chilies,1 tbsp raisins,10-12 raw or roasted cashews,5 to 8 eggs,Pinch of salt and red chili powder,
Spices:
2 bay leaves,2-3 small cinnamon sticks,½ mace blade,3 cloves,4 crushed green cardamom,1 crushed black cardamom,½ tsp black pepper
1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste,Salt 1 tsp + pinch (to taste),
Spices:
½ tsp coriander powder,¼ tsp cumin,¼ tsp freshly ground pepper
1 cup warm milk,2 tbsp plain yogurt,5-6 whole green chilies,¼ tsp garam masala,1 tbsp ghee,1 tbsp fried onion,A big pinch of sugar,3-4 tbsp cooking oil
instructions:
Preparation: Soak the onion, green chilies, raisins, and cashews in boiling water.

Boil Eggs: Shock the eggs in boiling water for 30 seconds, then simmer for 11 minutes. Transfer to cold water for 10-12 minutes, then peel.

Blend: Blend the soaked onion mixture into a smooth paste.

Fry Eggs: Lightly score the peeled eggs. Season with a pinch of salt and red chili. Fry in oil until light brown, then set aside.

Spice Infusion: In the same oil, add bay leaves, cinnamon, mace, cloves, and cardamom. Sauté for 30 seconds. Add ginger and garlic paste and sauté until fragrant.

Cook Onion Mixture: Add the blended onion mix and salt. Important: Cook over low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring regularly, until oil separates. This step is crucial for that perfect Korma flavor.

Add Spices: Add a splash of water, then coriander powder, cumin, and freshly ground pepper. Cook for 2 minutes.

Creamy Gravy: Add warm milk and plain yogurt. Bring to a boil.

Final Touch: Add the fried eggs, whole green chilies, garam masala, ghee, fried onion, and a big pinch of sugar. Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes.

name: Chili Chicken
ingredients:
420 g boneless chicken, cut into chunks, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp garlic paste, ½ tsp ginger paste, ½ tsp red chili / cayenne powder, 1 tsp soy sauce, 1 tsp white vinegar, ¼ tsp pepper, 1 tbsp corn flour, 1 tbsp maida / AP flour, 1 egg white, Cooking oil for frying,

For the Sauce:
1 tbsp cooking oil, 1¼ tsp chopped garlic, ½ tsp chopped ginger, ¼ tsp chopped green chili, 1 medium-sized red onion, cut into cubes, 1 green bell pepper, cut into cubes, 1½ tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp chili sauce, 1¼ tbsp ketchup, Pinch of salt, Pinch of sugar, ¼ cup water, 1½ tsp cornstarch, mixed with ¼ cup water (cornstarch slurry),

Garnish:
Sliced green onions (green part only)
instructions:
In a bowl, mix the chicken chunks with salt, garlic paste, ginger paste, cayenne powder, soy sauce, white vinegar, pepper, corn flour, maida / ap flour, and egg white until well-coated. Set aside.

Heat cooking oil in a pot. Once the oil is hot (around 300°F), add the chicken pieces. Cook for 4-5 minutes until crispy, frying in batches if necessary. Remove the chicken pieces from the oil, drain excess oil, and set them aside.

In a separate wok or pan, heat 1 tbsp of cooking oil over medium-high heat. Add the chopped garlic, ginger, and green chili. Sauté for 30-45 seconds until the garlic is slightly browned.

Add the cubed onion and green bell pepper. Sauté for 1-2 minutes, then add a pinch of salt.

Stir in the soy sauce, chili sauce, and ketchup, along with a pinch of sugar. Mix well.

Add ¼ cup of water and the fried chicken pieces to the wok. Stir until the chicken pieces are coated in the sauce.

Prepare the cornstarch slurry in a small cup by mixing the cornstarch with ¼ cup of water. Slowly pour the slurry into the wok, stirring continuously. Be mindful of the sauce's consistency - you may not need to use all the slurry.

Once the sauce and chicken are well combined and heated through, turn off the heat. Sprinkle with sliced green onions for garnish.

Your chili chicken is now ready to be served! Enjoy it with your favorite fried rice.

name: Kabuli Pulao
ingredients: 2 tbsp cooking oil, 1¼ cup chopped onions, 1 tbsp chopped garlic (approx. 4-5 large cloves), 500g mutton meat, 1½ tsp salt (or to taste), ½ tsp cumin, ¼ tsp pepper, 1½ cups of water, 3 cups soaked basmati rice, Few drops of lemon juice, 1 shredded carrot, 1 cup soaked raisins, 5 tbsp water, 1 tbsp sugar, 3 black cardamom seeds, 1 green cardamom, 4 cloves, ½ tsp roasted cumin powder, 2 tbsp butter
instructions:
Heat 2 tbsp of cooking oil in a pressure cooker, add the chopped onions and sauté until they become translucent.

Add the chopped garlic and sauté for another 30 seconds.

Add the mutton meat and sauté on medium-high heat for 1 minute.

Season with salt, cumin, and pepper. Add water, then close the pressure cooker and cook until the meat is tender (around 20-25 minutes depending on your pressure cooker).

Meanwhile, in a separate pot, boil water with 2 heaped tsp of salt. Cook the soaked basmati rice in this water for about 6-7 minutes until it is 90% cooked. Add a few drops of lemon juice to maintain the white color of the rice. Drain the rice and set it aside.

In a small pan, sauté the shredded carrot for 5 minutes on medium heat. Do the same with the soaked raisins, then set them aside.

In the same pan, add 1 tbsp of water and 1 tbsp of sugar. Cook until the sugar caramelizes and turns a brown color. Turn off the heat, add 4 tbsp of water and set this caramel syrup aside.

For the pulao masala, grind the black cardamom seeds, green cardamom, and cloves using a mortar and pestle. Add the roasted cumin powder and mix well.

Layer half of the rice in a deep pot, add the cooked meat and the remaining gravy (if the gravy is too liquid, reduce it by heating).

Add the remaining rice, followed by the caramelized sugar syrup, the pulao masala, sautéed carrots, raisins, and finally, 2 tbsp of butter.

Cover and cook on the lowest heat for 20 minutes (this process is also known as 'dum').

After 20 minutes, stir everything well so the rice is fully incorporated and gains a brownish color.

Cover the pot again, and your Kabuli Pulao is ready to serve hot!

name: Chicken Khichuri
ingredients: 1 whole chicken - 1.2kg small curry cut, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp red chili powder, ¾ tsp turmeric, ¾ tsp garam masala, ½ tsp cumin, ½ tsp coriander, 1½ tbsp garlic paste - 28g, 2 tbsp ginger paste - 34g, ¼ cup cooking oil + 2 tbsp, 2 medium onion (thinly sliced), ½ tsp shah jeera (black cumin), 8 cloves, 2 cinnamon (small), 4 cardamom (slightly bruised), 1 bay leaf, ¾ tsp pepper, 3 black cardamom pods, powdered, 1⁄8 tsp nutmeg, 7-8 green chili, 1 chopped tomato, ½ cup moong dal (soaked for 1 hour), ¼ cup masoor dal (soaked for 30 minutes), 3 cups kalijeera rice (soaked for 30 minutes), 4 cups hot water, salt, ¾ tsp roasted cumin, 2 tbsp fried onions, 2 tbsp coriander
instructions:
Marinate the Chicken:

In a large bowl, combine the chicken pieces with lemon juice, 2 tsp salt, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, cumin, coriander, garlic paste, ginger paste, and 1 tbsp oil. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Cook the Onions and Spices:

Heat ¼ cup + 2 tbsp cooking oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add sliced onions and sauté until light brown.

Add shah jeera, cloves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, and bay leaf. Stir well for a minute until fragrant.

Cook the Chicken:

Add the marinated chicken to the pot. Sauté on high heat for 5 minutes, then cover and cook on medium heat for another 5 minutes.

Stir in black pepper, powdered black cardamom, nutmeg, and green chilies. Continue to cook for 15 minutes on medium heat, stirring occasionally.

Add Dal, Rice, and Water:

Mix in the chopped tomato, soaked moong dal, and masoor dal. Add the soaked rice and mix everything together.

Pour in 4 cups of hot water and adjust salt to taste. Bring to a simmer, then cover and cook on very low heat for 20 minutes.

Garnish and Serve:

Once the rice and chicken are fully cooked, sprinkle roasted cumin powder, fried onions, and fresh chopped coriander on top for garnish.

Serve hot, ideally with a side of yogurt or raita.

name: Murgi Bhorta
ingredients:
Chicken Preparation:
750-gm chicken, 1 bay leaf, 1 tsp garlic paste, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp salt, 1 ½ cup water,

Bharta Flavouring:
3 tbsp cooking oil, 3 cloves, 1 cinnamon stick, 2 cardamom, 1 large onion paste, 1 tsp garlic paste, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp green chili paste, ½ cup tomato puree, ½ tsp salt, 1 tsp roasted coriander, 1 tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp roasted cumin, 2 tbsp yogurt + ¼ tsp sugar, 1 tbsp cashew paste, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 cup stock, 2 tbsp cream, 1 tsp kasuri methi, 2 boiled eggs, 1 tbsp butter
instructions:
1. Place chicken pieces in a pot along with bay leaf, salt, water, garlic and ginger paste

2. Cook for 20-25 minutes on low heat

3. Remove the chicken pieces and save the stock for later use

4. Shred the chicken using forks and remove the bones

5. Drizzle cooking oil in a pan and add cloves, cinnamon stick and cardamom

6. Stir in onion paste and sauté for 4-5 minutes on low-medium heat

7. Add garlic, ginger and green chili paste with a splash of stock 

8. Mix in tomato puree and salt 

9. Sauté for 2-3 minutes on medium heat

10. Add roasted coriander, red chili, turmeric, roasted cumin and another splash of stock 

11. Add yogurt and cashew paste

12. Mix in the shredded chicken, garam masala and stock

13. Gently mix in cream, kasuri methi, boiled eggs and butter before serving 

14. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken Resha Kabab
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless chicken, ¾ tsp salt, 1 tbsp lime juice, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp red chili, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 tsp mustard oil, 2 small boiled potatoes, ½ cup red onion, 3 tbsp fresh coriander, 1 ½ tbsp fresh mint, 2-3 green chilies, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 tsp roasted cumin seeds, ½ tsp pepper, 2 tbsp breadcrumbs, 1 egg
instructions:
1. Marinate the chicken pieces in salt, lime juice, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili, garam masala and mustard oil

2. Cook on stovetop for 12-15 minutes with lid on

3. Remove from heat and shred the chicken pieces

4. Mix in boiled potatoes, fresh coriander, chopped onion, fresh mint, green chilies, salt, garam masala, roasted cumin seeds, pepper, breadcrumbs and egg

5. Create round shaped kabab and coat in egg wash then fry until light golden brown

6. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken 65 Biryani
ingredients:
Chicken 65:
600 gm boneless chicken, 1 tsp cooking oil, ½ tsp salt, 1 tsp garlic paste, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 ½ tsp lemon juice, 1 ½ tsp curry leaves, 1 ½ tsp Kashmiri red chili, ½ tsp pepper, 1 ½ tbsp AP flour, 1 ½ tbsp cornflour, 1 cup onion, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp garlic paste, ¼ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp Kashmiri red chili, 1 tsp coriander, 8-10 curry leaves, 4 green chilies, 4 tbsp plain yogurt, ½ tsp sugar, 1 tsp garam masala, ½ tsp salt,

Rice:
1 tbsp salt, ½ tsp ginger paste, ½ tsp shah jeera, 2 cinnamon sticks, 2 bay leaves, 3 cardamoms, 4 cloves, 2 cups basmati rice, 3 tbsp fried onions, 2 tbsp fresh coriander, 1 tbsp fresh mint
instructions:
1. Mix chicken with cooking oil, salt, garlic paste, ginger paste, lemon juice, curry leaves, Kashmiri red chili, pepper, ap flour, and cornflour

2. Fry thinly sliced onions in a pot until brown on medium-high heat

3. Stir in garlic and ginger paste

4. Add turmeric, Kashmiri red chili, coriander, curry leaves, green chilies, plain yogurt, sugar, and garam masala

5. Salt to taste

6. Mix in the marinated chicken pieces

7. Prepare the rice by add salt, ginger paste, cinnamon sticks, cardamoms, cloves, and shah jeera to a large pot with hot water

8. Add soaked basmati rice

9. Cook rice for 5 minutes on high heat

10. Layer the chicken and rice and top it with fried onions, fresh coriander, and mint leaves

11. Cook the biryani for 15 minutes on low heat with the lid on

12. Mix well before serving

13. Ready to enjoy!

name: Loitta Shutki With Vegetable Bhuna
ingredients: 160-gram dried Bombay duck, ½ cup cooking oil, 2 medium potatoes, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp salt, 2 long eggplants, ½ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp salt, 2 medium onion, 10 garlic cloves sliced, 1 tbsp red chili, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp coriander, ½ tsp cumin, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup water
instructions:
1. Wash the shutki in a pan on stove with warm water for 30 minutes 

2. Using a new pan, drizzle cooking oil, add diced potatoes, turmeric and salt

3. Stir fry for 1-2 minutes and transfer out to a bowl

4. Repeat step 2 and 3 with long eggplants

5. Add sliced onion, sliced garlic, red chili, turmeric, coriander, salt, cumin and a splash of water and sauté for 5 minutes

6. Toss in the shutki, add water and cook for 5 minutes

7. Add potatoes and eggplant and cook for another 5 minutes while stirring occasionally 

8. Garnish with green chilies

9. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Loitta Shutki Bhuna
ingredients: Shutki 200 grams, Cooking oil 1/2 cup (total), Onions sliced 1 big, Garlic sliced 1 cup, Red chili powder 1 tsp, Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp, Eggplant (cut in 2 inch cubes) 1/2 lb, Potatoes (cut in 1 inch cube) 1 cup, Water, Salt to taste, Green chili 5-6 pcs
instructions:
Cut shutki into small (1 inch) pieces. Dry roast them over high heat for couple minutes. Remove from heat and soak them in water for 20 minutes. Cover with lid and set aside.

After soaking, wash the Shutki thoroughly in running water ( 4 -5 times). Shutki has a lot of dirt on its skin, so washing it thoroughly several times is essential. Drain water and set shutki aside.

 

 

Directions 

  

Heat oil in a pan, add eggplant, add pinch of turmeric powder and salt. Fry them for couple minutes over high heat. Remove onto a bowl and set aside. Repeat same process for potatoes and shutki. Both fried separately and kept aside.   

Add 1/4 cup oil to the same pan, add sliced onions and garlic, and sauté over med-high heat. Sauté for couple minutes until the onions and translucent.   

Add red chilli powder and turmeric powder, continue to sauté for couple minutes.  

Add fried potatoes and cook them for couple minutes. Add little water to avoid any sticking on the bottom of the pan.   

Add fried eggplant and continue to cook for couple minutes (add water as needed).   

Lastly add fried shutki, stir and mix everything together. You want to reduce all water and continue to sauté until the oil surfaces to the top.   

Add 1 cup water to the mix, reduce heat to low-medium, cover with lid and let it cook for 10 minutes. Keep stirring in between occasionally. Make sure to reduce all water, then add green chilli and remove from heat. The longer you cook, the tastier this dish gets, so if you feel the need to cook longer, go ahead!

name: Egg 65
ingredients:
For the Eggs:
6 boiled eggs, ½ tsp red chili, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp chopped garlic, ¼ tsp chopped ginger, 1 tbsp curry leaves, 1 chopped green chili, 4 tbsp AP flour, 3 tbsp breadcrumbs, 1 egg white, ½ tsp garam masala,

For the Sauce:
2 garlic cloves chopped, 3 dry red chili pieces, 8-10 curry leaves, 3 tbsp ketchup, 1 chopped green chili, 1 tbsp chopped coriander
instructions:
1. Remove the yolks from the boiled eggs

2. Cut the whites and transfer to a bowl

3. Mix the chopped boiled white eggs with red chili, salt, garlic, ginger, curry leaves, green chili, ap flour, breadcrumbs, and raw egg white

4. Add garam masala and give it one last mix

5. Create small spherical shapes and deep fry until light golden brown

6. In a separate pan, drizzle a bit of cooking oil and add chopped garlic, red chili, curry leaves, and ketchup

7. Stir for 2-3 minutes then add the deep-fried eggs

8. Garnish with fresh green chili and chopped coriander 

9. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken and Dal
ingredients: 2 cups water, 1 cup split chickpeas, 1 star anise, 1 bay leaf, ¼ tsp salt, ¼ tsp turmeric, 2 tsp cooking oil, 2 cinnamon sticks, 2 cardamoms, 3 cloves, 3 tbsp onion, 1 ¼ tsp garlic paste, 1 ¼ tsp ginger paste, ¼ tsp turmeric, ¼ tsp red chili, ½ tsp coriander, 1 tomato, 250 gm chicken breast, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 ½ cups hot water, 3 green chilies, ½ tsp roasted cumin, 2 tbsp fried onions
instructions:
1.       Pour water in a large pan and add soaked split chickpeas

2.       Add star anise, bay leaf, salt to taste, and turmeric

3.       Cover with lid and cook until soft on low heat

4.       Uncover and remove the bay leaf and star anise

5.       Remove the chickpeas from heat and set aside

6.       Wipe down pan and add cooking oil

7.       Stir in small cinnamon sticks, cardamoms, cloves, and thinly sliced onions

8.       Once the onion turns translucent, stir in garlic and ginger paste

9.       Pour in a splash of water as needed

10.   Mix in turmeric, red chili, and coriander

11.   Add a medium size chopped tomato

12.   Salt to taste

13.   Splash of water

14.   Cover with lid and cook for 3 minutes on low heat

15.   Uncover and mix in chicken breast pieces

16.   Add garam masala and the cooked chickpeas

17.   Pour in hot water 

18.   Add green chilies

19.   Cover with lid and cook for another 12 minutes on low to medium heat

20.   Uncover and finish off with roasted cumin and fried onion

21.   Ready to enjoy!

name: Bosnia Porota
ingredients: ½ cup warm milk, 1 tbsp active dry yeast, 1 tbsp sugar, 3 cups AP flour, 1 tsp salt, 2 ½ tbsp cooking oil, 1 egg, ¼ cup warm water
instructions:
1.     Mix in active dry yeast and sugar to a bowl with warm milk

2.     Mix in ap flour, salt to taste, cooking oil, egg, and warm water

3.     Knead for 3 to 4 minutes until dough is soft

4.     Coat dough with cooking oil and let it rest for 1 hour

5.     Cut dough into 9 pieces 

6.     Roll out the dough and deep fry in hot oil until golden brown 

7.     Ready to enjoy!

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
ingredients:
Dressing:
¼ cup onion, 1 ½ tbsp cider vinegar, 2 tsp dijon mustard,

Base:
½ tsp pepper, ½ tsp sugar, ½ tsp salt, 3 tbsp olive oil, 2 cups lettuce, 3 tbsp onion, 2 small cucumbers, 1 red bell pepper, 1 green bell pepper, 1 cup grilled chicken, 1 tsp lime juice
instructions:
1.     Place two pieces of chicken breast in a large pot 

2.     Pour a cup of water 

3.     Add the following for flavouring the chicken with onion, garlic cloves, and bay leaf

4.     Salt to taste

5.     Cover with lid and cook for 16 to 18 minutes

6.     Remove the chicken from heat and shred 

7.     Place shredded chicken in a large clear bowl

8.     Mix in mayonnaise and mustard

9.     Squeeze of a lime

10.  Salt and pepper to taste

11.  Toss in lettuce, onion, green chili, and fresh coriander

12.  Mix well and serve alone or on a tortilla as desired

13.  Ready to enjoy!

name: Shredded Chicken Salad
ingredients:
Chicken:
2 chicken breasts, 1 cup water, ¼ onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1 bay leaf, ¾ tsp salt, 2 ½ tbsp mayonnaise, 2 tbsp mustard, 1 lime,

Base:
2 cups lettuce, 3 tbsp onion, ½ tsp green chili, 3 tbsp coriander
instructions:
1.     Place two pieces of chicken breast in a large pot 

2.     Pour a cup of water 

3.     Add the following for flavouring the chicken with onion, garlic cloves, and bay leaf

4.     Salt to taste

5.     Cover with lid and cook for 16 to 18 minutes

6.     Remove the chicken from heat and shred 

7.     Place shredded chicken in a large clear bowl

8.     Mix in mayonnaise and mustard

9.     Squeeze of a lime

10.  Salt and pepper to taste

11.  Toss in lettuce, onion, green chili, and fresh coriander

12.  Mix well and serve alone or on a tortilla as desired

13.  Ready to enjoy!

name: Chicken Cashew Nut Salad
ingredients:
Chicken:
2 chicken breasts, 2 tbsp cooking oil, ½ cup raw cashews, 1 tbsp ginger, 1 tbsp garlic, 2 tbsp dark soy sauce, 3 tbsp sriracha, 1 lime, 1 tsp honey, 2 tbsp water, ½ tsp cornstarch,

Salad:
2 cups cabbage, 1 cup lettuce, 1 red bell pepper, 1 green bell pepper, 1 carrot, ½ cup coriander, ½ cup red onion, 1 green onion, ½ tsp sesame seeds
instructions:
1.     Cut up chicken breasts into bite-size cubes

2.     Sprinkle salt to taste on the chicken pieces

3.     Add cooking oil to a hot pan and roast raw cashews

4.     Remove the cashews from heat and set aside

5.     Stir in crushed ginger, minced garlic, and chicken pieces

6.     Add dark soy sauce, sriracha, lime and honey

7.     Prepare cornstarch slurry by mixing water with cornstarch  

8.     Pour over the chicken and mix well

9.     Remove from heat and let it cool 

10.  Add thinly shredded cabbage along with thinly cut lettuce, bell peppers, carrots, fresh coriander, and red onion to a large clear bowl and mix well

11.  Top it off with the cooled chicken 

12.  Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions 

13.  Ready to enjoy!

name: Steamed Egg Curry
ingredients: 7 eggs, 4 tbsp poppy seeds, ½ cup onion, 5 green chilies, ¼ tsp salt, 1 tbsp mustard oil, ½ tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, ¼ tsp salt, 2 tbsp mustard oil, ½ tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp sugar, 3 green chilies
instructions:
1.     Boil eggs for 10 minutes then transfer to a bowl of ice water

2.     Soak poppy seeds in water for 15 minutes then drain out the excess water and wash with cold water

3.     Blend the soaked poppy seeds with onion, green chilies, and salt

4.     Set aside the poppy seed puree

5.     Stir fry the boiled eggs for 2-3 minutes in a pan with mustard oil, red chili, turmeric, and salt

6.     Set the egg aside 

7.     Mix the poppy seed puree with mustard oil, red chili, turmeric, and salt to taste in a pot 

8.     Gradually mix in water 

9.     You may add sugar as an option for a hint of sweetness

10.  Place the fried boiled eggs into the pot and cover with a lid

11.  Steam for 12-14 minutes

12.  Ready to enjoy!

name: Aloo Dal
ingredients: 4 medium boiled potatoes, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 ½ tsp salt, 5 ½ cups water, 1 bay leaf, 1 tbsp cooking oil, 3 eggs, 2 tbsp cooking oil, 1 tsp panch phoron, 6-7 garlic, ½ cup sliced onion, 4-5 green chilies, 2 dry red chilies, ½ tsp roasted cumin, 3 tbsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1.     Mash the boiled potatoes

2.     Add coriander, cumin, red chili, and turmeric

3.     Salt to taste

4.     Pour water and mix well

5.     Transfer the potato puree to a large pot

6.     Add a bay leaf 

7.     Simmer for 15-20 minutes on medium heat

8.     Stir continuously 

9.     In a separate pan, drizzle cooking oil and add whisked egg

10.  Salt to taste

11.  Remove the egg from the pan once fried

12.  Drizzle cooking oil in pan 

13.  Fry panch phoron, garlic, and sliced onion

14.  Stir in fresh green chilies and dry red chilies

15.  Saute until onions are brown

16.  Transfer the sauteed onions and spices to the pot with aloo

17.  Add the fried eggs

18.  Sprinkle roasted cumin

19.  Garnish with fresh coriander

20.  Ready to enjoy!

name: Dal Murgi
ingredients: 1 ½ cups chana dal, 2 cups water, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp turmeric, 3 tbsp cooking oil, 1 medium onion, 2 bay leaves, 3 dry red chilies, 2 cinnamon sticks, 5 cardamom, 6 cloves, 8-10 peppercorn, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tbsp garlic paste, 1 tbsp ginger paste, ½ tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp salt, 1 kg chicken, ½ tsp garam masala, 2 ½ cups hot water, ½ tsp cumin, 1 tsp ghee, 2 tbsp fried onions
instructions:
1. Soak chana dal for 30 minutes

2. Place chana in a pot along with water, salt to taste and turmeric

3. Cover with lid and cook for 15-17 minutes

4. Drizzle cooking oil in a large pot 

5. Add thinly sliced onions, bay leaves, dry red chilies, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, cloves, peppercorn, and cumin seeds

6. Stir in garlic and ginger paste

7. Splash of water

8. Mix in red chili, turmeric, coriander, and salt

9. Saute for 2 minutes

10. Add curry cut chicken pieces and mix well

11. Cover with lid and cook for 5 minutes on medium heat

12. Saute until water evaporates for 2 minutes on high heat

13. Add in the cooked chana 

14. Add garam masala, and pour in hot water

15. Cook for 15 minutes on low heat 

16. Stir occasionally

17. Uncover and cook for another 10 minutes on medium to high heat

18. Garnish with roasted cumin, fried onions, and ghee

19. Ready to enjoy!

name: Achari Chicken
ingredients: 550 gm boneless chicken thighs, 1 tsp salt, 1 tbsp chili flakes, ½ tsp turmeric, 6-7 large garlic cloves, 1 tbsp ginger paste, 1 tbsp mustard oil, ½ tsp fenugreek seeds, 1 tsp black mustard, 1 tsp fennel seeds, 1 tsp garam masala, ¾ cup cooking oil, 1 ½ cup onion, 1/8 tsp hing, 1 ¼ tbsp ginger, 1 ¼ tbsp garlic, 2/3 cup white vinegar, 1 tsp salt, 2 ½ tbsp mustard oil
instructions:
1.       Mix boneless chicken thighs with salt, chili flakes, turmeric, mashed garlic cloves, and ginger paste

2.       Coat with mustard oil and let it marinate for 30 minutes or more

3.       Toast fenugreek seeds, black mustard seeds, and fennel seeds for 1 to 2 minutes on low heat until fragrant

4.       Transfer the toasted seeds and crush it with garam masala using a mortar and pestle 

5.       Pour in cooking oil in a large pan and add thinly sliced onion and fry for 12 minutes on medium heat until golden brown

6.       Remove the onion from heat once it has reached the gold brown colour

7.       Add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan and fry for 6-7 minutes on medium heat

8.       Remove the chicken from pan and set aside

9.       Add hing, ginger and garlic paste, and the spice mix from earlier

10.   Sauté the spices for 2 minutes with the heat off

11.   Pour in white vinegar and bring to a simmer

12.   Add salt to taste

13.   Add the chicken pieces along with fried onions, mustard oil, and cool for 2 to 3 minutes

14.   Turn off the heat and serve with rice or roti

15.   Ready to enjoy!

name: Prawn Curry
ingredients: 1 ¾ cups coconut, 1 ½ cups hot water, 500 grams prawn, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp red chili, 1 medium onion, 1 bay leaf, 3 green chilies, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 medium tomato, ¾ tsp salt, 1 tbsp tomato paste, 1 tsp coriander, ½ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp red chili, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 ¼ cups of coconut milk, ¾ tsp roasted cumin, 1 tbsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1. Prepare coconut milk and set aside

2. Marinate prawn with turmeric, salt, and red chili

3. Fry prawn for 30 seconds on each side

4. Remove prawn from heat and add chopped onion

5. Add bay leaf, fresh green chilies, ginger paste, and diced tomato

6. Salt to taste 

7. Stir in tomato paste along with a splash of water

8. Add coriander, turmeric, and red chili

9. Saute for 6-7 minutes

10. Splash of water

11. Gradually stir in coconut milk

12. Add garam masala and prawn 

13. Cook for 5-6 minutes on medium-high heat with a lid on

14. Garnish with roasted cumin and fresh coriander

15. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Fried Eggplant
ingredients:
For Marination:
1 large "chubby" eggplant, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp garlic paste, ½ tsp ginger paste, ½ tsp red chili powder, ¼ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tbsp cooking oil, 1 tbsp chopped coriander,

For Coating:
¼ cup suji/rawa/semolina, 2¼ tbsp rice flour, ½ tsp coriander powder, ¼ tsp salt,

For Frying:
1-2 tbsp cooking oil
instructions:
Prepare the Eggplant
Slice the Eggplant: Take a large, chubby eggplant and cut it into thin slices.

Score the Slices: Lightly score the surface of each slice to help the marinade penetrate.

Marinate the Eggplant
Prepare the Marinade: In a deep bowl, combine salt, garlic paste, ginger paste, red chili powder, turmeric, and cooking oil. Mix well.

Add Coriander: Add 1 tbsp of chopped coriander to the marinade and mix again.

Coat the Eggplant: Add the eggplant slices to the bowl and gently coat them with the marinade. Set aside.

Prepare the Coating
Mix Dry Ingredients: On a separate plate, mix suji/rawa/semolina, rice flour, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.

Fry the Eggplant
Coat the Slices: Take a marinated eggplant slice and coat it in the suji mixture. Shake off any excess.

Heat Oil: In a non-stick pan, add 1-2 tbsp of cooking oil and heat over medium heat.

Fry the Slices: Add the coated eggplant slices to the pan and fry for about 7 minutes, flipping them occasionally to ensure all sides are cooked well.

Serve
Serve the crispy eggplant fry with hot rice or as an appetizer.

name: Daab Chingri
ingredients:
Shrimp:
1 coconut, 1 tbsp coconut jelly, 3 tbsp mustard oil, 500-gram shrimp, ¼ tsp salt,

Sauce:
¼ tsp turmeric, 3 tbsp onion paste, 2 garlic clove paste, 1 tbsp mustard paste, 1 tsp green chili paste, 2 tbsp coconut, ½ tsp salt, ½ cup of coconut milk, 4 tbsp coconut water, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp sugar
instructions:
1. Cut the top off the coconut and pour out the coconut water into a bowl

2. Scrape out some coconut jelly 

3. In a pan, stir fry shrimp in mustard oil, salt, and turmeric for 1 minute

4. Remove shrimp from heat

5. Add onion paste, garlic paste, mustard paste, green chili paste, coconut, salt, and coconut milk

6. Stir in water, turmeric, and sugar

7. Add back the shrimp and mix well 

8. Transfer the dish inside the coconut 

9. Seal the coconut with wheat dough and steam for 10 minutes

10. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Bhoger Khichuri
ingredients: 2 tbsp cooking oil, 1 small diced potato, 1 cup cauliflower, 3 dry red chilies, 2 bay leaves, 1 small cinnamon stick, 3 cloves, 2 cardamom, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 small chopped tomato, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp ginger paste, ½ cup-soaked moong dal, 1 cup-soaked rice, 4 cups of water, ¼ cup green peas, 3 green chilies, 1 tsp ghee, 1 tsp garam masala
instructions:
1. In a large pot, add cooking oil such as mustard oil or ghee

2. Stir in potato and cauliflower

3. Salt to taste

4. Transfer out the vegetables 

5. Add cooking oil, dry red chilies, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom and stir 

6. Stir in cumin seeds, salt, and chopped tomato

7. Add a splash of water along with turmeric, red chili, soaked rice, and soaked moong dal

8. Fry for 2 minutes

9. Pour water and the vegetables from earlier 

10. Cook until soft on low-medium heat with the lid on 

11. Add green peas and green chilies 

12. Cook for another 5 minutes 

13. Add ghee and garam masala before serving 

14. To prepare the second type of khichuri, add moong dal along with rice in a pot with cooking oil 

15. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes 

16. Pour water, turmeric, red chili, and salt

17. Cook until soft with the lid on 

18. Prepare masala in a pan by adding ghee, cumin seeds, ginger, green chilies, chopped onion, and tomato 

19. Sauté for 5-6 minutes

20. Add peas and the soft moong dal and rice 

21. Garnish with fresh coriander and ghee

22. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Masala Khichuri
ingredients: 1 tbsp ghee, ½ cup moong dal, 1 cup of rice, 4 cups of water, ½ tsp turmeric, ¼ tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp salt, 2 tbsp ghee, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp finely chopped ginger, 2 chopped green chilies, ½ cup chopped onion, 1 small chopped tomato, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp red chili, ¼ tsp coriander, ½ tsp turmeric, ¼ cup green peas, 1 tsp ghee, 1 tbsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1. In a large pot, add cooking oil such as mustard oil or ghee

2. Stir in potato and cauliflower

3. Salt to taste

4. Transfer out the vegetables 

5. Add cooking oil, dry red chilies, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom and stir 

6. Stir in cumin seeds, salt, and chopped tomato

7. Add a splash of water along with turmeric, red chili, soaked rice, and soaked moong dal

8. Fry for 2 minutes

9. Pour water and the vegetables from earlier 

10. Cook until soft on low-medium heat with the lid on 

11. Add green peas and green chilies 

12. Cook for another 5 minutes 

13. Add ghee and garam masala before serving 

14. To prepare the second type of khichuri, add moong dal along with rice in a pot with cooking oil 

15. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes 

16. Pour water, turmeric, red chili, and salt

17. Cook until soft with the lid on 

18. Prepare masala in a pan by adding ghee, cumin seeds, ginger, green chilies, chopped onion, and tomato 

19. Sauté for 5-6 minutes

20. Add peas and the soft moong dal and rice 

21. Garnish with fresh coriander and ghee

22. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Simple Egg Curry
ingredients:
Egg:
4 eggs, ¼ tsp salt, 1 tbsp freshly chopped coriander,

Sauce:
¼ cup sliced onion, 1 medium chopped tomato, ½ tsp salt to taste, 1 tsp ground coriander, ½ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp red chili powder, ½ cup of water, 3-4 green chilies, 1 tbsp freshly chopped coriander, ½ tsp ground roasted cumin
instructions:
1. Whisk eggs with salt and chopped coriander leaves in a bowl

2. Cook in three batches and fold like an omelet, then cut into squares

3. Should make approx 9-10 pieces in total

4. Remove egg and set aside

5. Sauté sliced onion and tomatoes 

6. Add salt to taste, ground coriander, turmeric, red chili, and a splash of water

7. Sauté for 5-6 minutes on medium-high heat and pour water 

8. Transfer egg to the saucepan and cook for 2-3 minutes

9. Garnish with green chili, coriander leaves, and ground roasted cumin

10. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Begun Kofta Curry
ingredients: 3 eggplants, 2 chopped green chilies, ¼ tsp turmeric, ¾ cup chickpea flour, ½ tsp salt, 2 tbsp sliced onion, 1 medium potato, 2 tbsp cooking oil, ¼ cup sliced onion, ½ tsp garlic paste, ½ tsp ginger paste, ½ tsp red chili, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp coriander, ½ tsp roasted cumin, 1 medium tomato, ½ tsp salt, 1 tsp ghee, 2 green chilies, 1 tsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1. Coat the whole eggplants with oil 

2. Grill the eggplants

3. Remove the skin and transfer the eggplants into a clear bowl

4. Mash the eggplants 

5. Mix in green chilies, turmeric, chickpea flour, and sliced onion

6. Take about a tablespoon of the mixture and drop it in deep oil 

7. Deep fry until golden brown on medium heat

8. Deep dry potato cuts until light brown

9. Drizzle cooking oil in a pan and add sliced onion, garlic paste, ginger paste, and a splash of water 

10. Stir in red chili, turmeric, coriander, roasted cumin, tomato, and salt to taste

11. Add the fried potatoes and a splash of water

12. Fry for 2-3 minutes 

13. Stir and cover with a lid to cook for 2 minutes

14. Remove lid and add the fried eggplants 

15. Garnish with ghee, green chilies, and fresh coriander

16. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Parda Biryani
ingredients:
Biryani:
1 kg mutton, 1 ½ tsp salt, 3 tsp coriander, 3 tsp fennel, 1 medium onion, 4 cups of water, 3 tbsp cooking oil, 1 tbsp butter, 2-3 bay leaves, 6 cloves, 5 cardamom, 1 black cardamom, 2 small cinnamon sticks, 8-10 pepper, ½ tsp cumin, ½ cup sliced onion, 1 tbsp ginger paste, 4 garlic cloves paste, 1 tbsp cashew paste, 1 tsp green chili paste, 2 tbsp plain yogurt, 1 tbsp biryani masala, 2 ½ cups of rice, 4 cups reserved stock, 1 tbsp fried onion, 1 tbsp food coloring,

Parda:
2 cups wheat flour, ¼ tsp salt, 1 tbsp ghee or oil, ¾ cup of water
instructions:
1. Using a large pot, mix in mutton with salt, coriander, fennel, medium onion, and water

2. Cook for 50 minutes on low-medium heat with the lid on

3. Prepare the dough by missing wheat flour, salt, ghee, and water

4. Knead a soft dough

5. Saranwrap to rest 

6. Strain out the meat and filter out the stock for later use

7. Add butter and cooking oil in a pan along with cloves, bay leaves, cardamom, cinnamon sticks, and cumin

8. Stir for a minute before adding in the sliced onion

9. Stir in ginger paste, garlic paste, cashew paste, green chili paste, and cooked mutton 

10. Mix in yogurt, biryani masala, rice, and reserved stock

11. Salt to taste

12. Cook on high heat until water evaporates

13. Sprinkle fried onions on top 

14. Cover with lid and cook for 15 minutes on low heat

15. Roll out the dough to a large round sheet 

16. Add biryani, food coloring, and fried onions 

17. Fold in the dough to cover up the biryani 

18. Cook for 5 minutes on high heat

19. Flip sides and cook for another 10 minutes on medium-low heat

20. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Dum Chicken
ingredients: 5 garlic cloves, 3 green chilies, 1-inch ginger, 1.2 kg of chicken pieces, 12 cashews, 10 almonds, ¼ cup desiccated coconut, ¼ cup fresh coriander and mint, 1 ½ tsp red chili, ¾ tsp turmeric, 1 ½ tsp coriander, 1 ½ tsp garam masala, 1 ½ tsp salt, 3 tbsp plain yogurt, ¾ tsp pepper, ¾ cup fried onions, 4 tbsp cooking oil
instructions:
1. Blend garlic, green chilies, and ginger with a splash of water

2. Add the paste to chicken pieces

3. Blend cashews, almonds, desiccated coconut with a splash of water

4. Add the fine paste to the chicken 

5. Add fresh chopped coriander and mint 

6. Add red chili, turmeric, coriander, garam masala, salt, and plain yogurt

7. Mix well then add pepper and fried onions

8. Gently mix again then marinate for a minimum of 15 minutes

9. In a pan, drizzle cooking oil and cook the chicken pieces for 5 minutes on high heat with the lid on

10. Place pan on top of another flat pan and cook for 15 minutes on low heat with the lid on

11. Remove lid and stir then cook for another 35 minutes on low heat with the lid on

12. Garnish with fresh herb before serving

13. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients:
For the Chicken:
500-gram boneless chicken pieces, 1 tsp lime juice, ½ tsp salt, 3 tbsp plain yogurt, ½ tsp red chili, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp coriander, ½ tsp cumin, ½ tsp garam masala, ½ tsp garlic paste, ½ tsp ginger paste, 1 tbsp mustard oil,

For the Gravy:
4 tbsp cooking oil, 1 tsp cumin, 1 small onion, ½ tsp garlic paste, ½ tsp ginger paste, 2 small crushed tomatoes, ½ tsp coriander, ½ tsp red chili, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp cumin, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup of water, 2 ½ tbsp cream, ½ tsp kasuri methi
instructions:
1. Marinate chicken with lime juice, salt, plain yogurt, red chili, turmeric, coriander, cumin, garam masala, mustard oil, ginger, and garlic paste

2. Marinate for a minimum of 30 minutes

3. Drizzle cooking oil in a pan and cook on low-medium heat for 5 minutes on each side 

4. Check internal temperature before removing from the heat 

5. In a separate pan, sauté onion until soft with cooking oil, cumin seeds, and crushed tomato

6. Sauté for 5-6 minutes

7. Stir in coriander, red chili, turmeric, cumin, salt, and garam masala 

8. Sauté for another 3-4 minutes 

9. Pour water and the chicken pieces

10. Cook for 1-2 minutes 

11. Drizzle cream and garnish with Kasuri methi before serving 

12. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Masala Egg Pulao
ingredients:
2 tbsp cooking oil, 2 tsp butter, 1 tsp cumin, 1 medium onion, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp red chili, 1 ½ tsp coriander, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 small tomato, 3 green chilies, ¾ tsp salt, 3 eggs, 1 tsp fresh coriander, 4-5 cups cooked basmati rice, ¼ tsp pepper, 2 boiled eggs, ¼ tsp garam masala, ¼ tsp lime juice,

Garnish:
1 tsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1. Heat cumin seeds in cooking oil and butter 

2. Add chopped onions and sauté 

3. Stir in ginger paste, red chili, coriander, turmeric, and a splash of water 

4. Sauté for 2-3 minutes on medium heat

5. Toss in chopped tomatoes, green chilies, salt, whisked eggs, and fresh coriander

6. Add cooked basmati rice and mix 

7. Grate boiled eggs, sprinkle garam masala, squeeze lime juice and give it a final stir

8. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving 

9. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Shrimp Biryani
ingredients:
Shrimp:
1 lb fresh large shrimp, ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp turmeric, ½ tsp shah jeera, 2 bay leaves, 2 small cinnamon sticks, 5 cardamom, 5 cloves, 8-10 peppercorn, 1 medium sliced onion, 1 tsp garlic, 1 tsp ginger, 4-5 green chili paste, 1 small chopped tomato, ½ tsp ground coriander, ½ red chili, 1 tsp salt, 2 tbsp coconut paste,

Rice:
½ tsp shah jeera, 2 small bay leaves, 2 small cinnamon sticks, 4 cardamom, 4 cloves, 3 tbsp sliced onion, 3 cups soaked rice, ½ tsp ginger, 6 cups hot water, 1 tsp salt, 4 tbsp fried onions, 2 tbsp ghee, 4-5 green chilies, 2 tbsp food coloring, 2 tbsp fresh coriander, 1 tsp garam masala
instructions:
1. Mix the shrimp pieces with salt and turmeric

2. Transfer the shrimp to a frying pan with a bit of cooking oil for 

3. Once the shrimps are cooked, remove from the pan

4. Stir in the shah jeera, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, cloves, peppercorn, and sliced onion

5. After 2-3 minutes add garlic, ginger, green chili paste, chopped tomato, ground coriander, red chili, salt, coconut paste, and a splash of water 

6. Add the shrimp to the saucepan and remove from heat 

7. It a large pot, drizzle cooking oil, temper the shah jeera along with bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, and cloves until fragrant 

8. Add sliced onion, rice that has been soaked for 30 minutes, ginger, hot water, and salt

9. Cook for 6-7 minutes on high heat and stir occasionally 

10. Cook for another 10 minutes on low heat with a lid on

11. Add fried onions, shrimps, ghee, green chilies, optional food coloring, freshly chopped coriander leaves, and garam masala

12. Cook for 10 more minutes on low heat with the lid on

13. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken Yakhni Pulao
ingredients: Yakhni Broth: 1.5 kg chicken pieces,1-inch sliced ginger,4 garlic cloves,1 medium red onion,1 ½ tsp cumin,1 ½ tbsp coriander,1 ½ tsp fennel seeds,2 bay leaves,8 cloves,5 cardamom,2 cinnamon sticks,½ tsp peppercorn,1-star anise,1 black cardamom,1 tbsp salt,6 cups water,Rice: ½ cup cooking oil,2 tbsp butter,½ cup sliced onion,4 cardamom,6 cloves,1 tsp cumin,7-8 black peppercorns,1 bay leaf,1 ½ tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste,¼ tsp mace,¼ tsp nutmeg,½ cup plain yogurt,1 tsp sugar,5-6 green chilies,6 cups yakhni broth,4 cups basmati rice,1 tsp salt to taste,1 tbsp ghee,2 tbsp fried onions
instructions:
1. Using a large pot, add chicken, ginger, garlic, onion, cumin, coriander, fennel seeds, bay leaves, cloves, black peppercorn, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, star anise, black cardamom, salt, and water 

2. Cook for 10 minutes on high heat with a lid on

3. Cook for another 20 minutes on low heat with the lid on

4. Transfer the chicken pieces to a separate bowl and set aside

5. Strain out the yakhni broth into a cup to use it for later

6. Sauté onion in butter and cooking oil until brown

7. Stir in cardamom, cloves, cumin, black peppercorn, bay leaf, ginger paste, and garlic paste

8. Add chicken pieces from earlier, mace, nutmeg, sugar, and plain yogurt

9. Add green chilies, reserved yakhni broth, and basmati rice

10. Salt to taste and cook until water is reduced

11. Cook for 15-20 minutes on low heat

12. Drizzle ghee and fried onions on top before serving

13. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Mughlai Chicken
ingredients: Marinate: 1 kg chicken,1 tsp salt,1 tsp lime juice,½ cup plain yogurt,1 tsp garlic paste,1 tsp ginger paste,½ tsp turmeric,Cooking: 4 tbsp cooking oil,1 tsp cumin seeds,2 cinnamon sticks,5 cardamom,5 cloves,2 bay leaves,8 black peppercorns,1 tbsp coriander powder,1 tsp red chili powder,1 tsp cumin powder,12 cashew (paste),12 almond (paste),1 cup fried onions,1.5 cups hot water,½ tsp salt,Garnish: ½ cup cream,½ cup fried onion,4-5 green chilies
instructions:
1. Marinate the chicken with salt, lime juice, yogurt, garlic paste, ginger paste, and turmeric and set aside

2. Temper the following in cooking oil until fragrant; cumin seeds, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, cloves, bay leaves and black peppercorns

3. Add the marinated chicken and sauté for 10 minutes

4. Add coriander powder, red chili powder, cumin powder to the pot of chicken and stir fry for 5 minutes

5. Add cashew-almond paste, fried onion and stir fry for another 5 minutes

6. Pour water, salt to taste, cover and cook for 15 minutes on medium-low heat with lid on

7. Cook for another 5 minutes with the lid off and garnish with cream, green chilies and fried onions

8. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken Curry And Tomato Tok
ingredients: Chicken Curry: 4 tbsp cooking oil,1 tsp cumin seeds,5 cardamom,3 bay leaves,2 cinnamon sticks,6 cloves,1 ½ kg chicken,1 cup thinly sliced onion,4 cloves garlic paste,1 tbsp ginger paste,1 tsp red chili,1 tsp coriander powder,½ tsp turmeric,1 tsp salt,1 cup water,1 tsp garam masala,4-5 green chili,Tomato Tok: 4-5 chopped tomatoes,2 tbsp sliced red onion,1 tsp salt,½ tsp turmeric,¼ tsp coriander powder,4 tbsp lime juice,2 tsp oil,2 ½ cups water,1 clove garlic,3-4 green chili,2 tbsp freshly chopped coriander
instructions:
1. Drizzle oil, cumin seeds, cardamom, cinnamon sticks, cloves, bay leaves, chicken and give it a stir

2. Add onion, garlic paste, ginger paste, red chili, coriander, turmeric then sauté for 10 minutes on high heat

3. Add salt, water and cook for 30 minutes with the lid on while stirring occasionally 

4. Prepare tomato tok by adding chopped tomatoes into a pot, along with sliced red onion, salt, turmeric, coriander powder, lime juice, oil, water and cook for 6 minutes with the lid on

5. Remove lid, add chopped garlic, green chili, fresh coriander then cook for another 6 minutes 

6. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Mustard Salmon
ingredients: Marinate: 4 pcs salmon fillet,1 tsp lime juice,¼ tsp salt,¼ tsp red chili powder,¼ tsp turmeric,Paste: 3 pcs green chili,2 tbsp mustard seeds,¼ tsp salt,Cooking: 2 pcs onion,¼ tsp turmeric,¼ tsp red chili,1 cup coconut milk,½ tsp salt,Garnish: 6 pcs green chili
instructions:
1. Marinate the salmon fillet with lime juice, salt, red chili powder, and turmeric

2. Drizzle oil in a pan, fry for 1-2 minute on each side then set aside

3. Mix green chilis, mustard seeds, and salt with a splash of water using a mortar and pestle

4. Remove the salmon, and add onion and sauté until translucent then add turmeric, red chili, paste, salt, and coconut milk

5. Once the oil has separated, add the salmon and cook for 4-5 minutes on low heat with a lid on

6. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Mutton Rezala
ingredients: Paste: 3 tbsp plain yogurt,3 tbsp fried onion,10-12 pcs cashew,¼ tsp mace,10-12 pcs raisin,Cooking: ¼ cup cooking oil,2 tbsp unsalted butter,3 pcs onion,2 tbsp ginger paste,1 ½ tbsp garlic paste,2 pcs bay leaves,2 pcs cinnamon sticks,5 pcs cardamom,5 pcs cloves,¼ tsp red chili powder,1 tbsp cumin powder,1 tbsp coriander powder,1 kg mutton,1 tsp salt,¼ tsp peppercorn,1 cup water,1 tsp garam masala,3-4 pcs prune,3 pcs dry red chilies,1 tbsp ghee,1 cup milk,2 tbsp fried onion,½ tsp kewra water
instructions:
1. Make the paste using plain yogurt, fried onion, cashew, mace and raisin

2. In a pan, add cooking oil, butter and sliced onion then sauté until tender

3. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom, cloves and give it a mix

4. Add red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander power and stir on medium-high heat while gradually adding splashes of water to prevent any burning of spices

5. Now add the meat along with salt and peppercorn and sauté for 10 minutes on medium-high heat

6. Add the paste and water and cook for 25 minutes on low-medium heat with lid on

7. Add garam masala, prunes, dry red chili, clarified butter, and warm milk

8. Cook for another 15-25 minutes on low heat with lid on

9. Add fried onion and kewra water then serve while hot

10. Enjoy!

name: Fish with Vegetables
ingredients: Fish Preparation: 1 ½ lb Haddock fillets,1 tsp lime juice,Salt to taste,Pepper to taste,1 tsp soy sauce,1 egg,Vegetable: 1 cup cabbage,¼ cup carrot,1 cup green papaya,2 tbsp cooking oil,2 garlic cloves,1 tbsp ginger,1 medium onion,½ tsp salt,¼ cup bell pepper,1 tsp soy sauce,1 tsp fish sauce,¾ tsp peppercorn,½ tsp sugar,4-5 pcs green chili,½ tsp corn starch,½ cup water
instructions:
1. Cut the fillet into small pieces, add lime juice, salt, pepper, soy sauce, and one beaten egg

2. Mix well using your hand then let it marinate for minimum 10 minutes

3. In a bowl put a generous amount of flour to use for coating the fish

4. Coat the fish pieces with flour and shake off any excess flour then fry in a pan with a drizzle of oil golden brown on each side

5. In a pot of water with a dash of salt, add cabbage, carrot, papaya and boil for 3-4 minutes

6. In a separate pan with oil, minced garlic, sliced ginger, sliced red onion, salt, and vegetable mix, bell pepper, soy sauce, fish sauce, peppercorn, sugar, green chili, and corn starch mixed with water

7. Stir for 2-3 minutes on medium heat then remove from the heat and pour it over the fried fish fillet pieces before serving

8. Enjoy!

name: Shrimp Malai Curry
ingredients: Cooking: 4 tbsp cooking oil,2 pcs bay leaf,1 pc onion,¼ cup onion paste,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste,½ tsp turmeric,1 tsp cumin powder,1 tsp coriander,1 tsp red chili,1 tsp salt,½ cup coconut powder,4-5 pcs green chili,1 cup coconut milk,2 cups shrimp,1 ¼ cup water,Garnish: 1 tsp roasted cumin powder,2 tbsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1. Add cooking oil to a frying pan, sliced onion and bay leaves, sauté until light brown 

2. Add onion paste, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric, cumin powder, coriander, red chili powder, salt and sauté for another 5-6 minute

3. Add coconut powder along with a splash of water as you sauté for another 3 minutes then add green chili, coconut milk, water, and shrimp

4. Cook for 5-6 minutes with a lid on then garnish with roasted cumin powder and fresh coriander

5. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Jali Kabab
ingredients: Mutton mince 1 lb,Coriander 1 tbsp,Salt to taste,Mint leaves 1 tbsp,Garlic 1 tbsp,Ginger 1 tbsp,Ketchup 1 tbsp,Red chili powder 1.5 tsp,Garam masala 1 tsp,Black pepper 1/2 tsp,White bread 4 slices,Milk to soak bread,Ghee 1 tsp,Green chili 1 tbsp,Fried onions (Beresta) 2 tbsp,Egg 1
instructions:
In a bowl, mix minced meat with coriander, mint leaves, garlic, ginger, ketchup, red chilli powder, black pepper, garam masala, ghee, green chilli, egg, fried onions (beresta) and salt to taste.

Soak bread in milk, squeeze excess milk and add to the kabab mix. Mix all ingredients well. Divide into small portions and shape them into kabab patties.

Cooking:

Heat oil in a pan, enough to deep fry!

Beat 2 eggs in a small bowl, coat both sides of the kabab. This will give the kabab a jali (net) texture on top. Make sure the oil is hot before frying the kababs.

Serve hot!

name: Chicken Tehari
ingredients: Chicken Ingredients: Chicken 5 pcs,Cooking oil 1/4 cup,Mustard oil 1/4 cup,Bay leaves 2 leaves,Cardamom 4,Cinnamon 4 sticks,Cloves 4,Onion sliced 1 cup,Garlic paste 1 tbsp,Ginger paste 2 tbsp,Salt to taste,Hot water 1 cup,Plain yogurt 1/4 cup,Sugar 1 tsp,Nutmeg and mace 1/4 tsp,Prunes 5 pcs,Rice Ingredients: Cooking oil 1/8 cup,Mustard oil 1/4 cup,Onion chopped 1 cup,White basmati rice 3 cups,Hot water 3 cups,Green chili sliced 6 pcs
instructions:
Wash and soak basmati rice in a bowl for at least 1hr before cooking. Drain the water and keep it aside.

Directions 

In a heated pan, add cooking oil and mustard oil, add bay leaves, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon and onion. Sauté until onions are translucent. Add chicken pieces, garlic, ginger paste and salt to taste. Saute chicken at high heat, add yogurt mix ( yogurt + sugar), nutmeg, mace and prunes. Continue to sauté for 10 mins at high heat. Add 1 cup hot water to cook the chicken under closed lid. Cook for 10 mins at high heat, occasionally stirring in between. The chicken will have gravy that will be mixed with rice.

In another pan, add mustard oil, cooking oil and chopped onions. Saute onions until they are translucent. Add soaked basmati rice, hot water and salt to taste. Close lid and cook rice until it's half done at high heat. Add chicken mix into the pan with rice and mix them all together. Add green chilli and cook tehari further under low heat and closed lid. Cook for 20 mins at dome (dome is a process to cook at very low heat and closed lid. This process can also be substituted for baking in the oven.)

Serve hot, enjoy!

name: Chicken Boti Kabab
ingredients: Chicken breast 2,Salt 1 tsp,Chili flakes 1 tsp,Garam masala 1 tsp,Red chili 1 tsp,Coriander 1 tsp,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Ginger paste 1 tsp,Onion paste 2 tbsp,Poppy seed paste 1 tsp,Plain/Natural yogurt 4 tbsp,Fried onions 2-3 tbsp,Papaya paste 1 tsp,Roasted gram flour 2 ½ tsp,Mustard oil 2 tbsp
instructions:
1. Cut the chicken breasts into cubes.

2. In a bowl add all the marinade ingredients and mix the chicken pieces well. Bring a heated coal at the center of the bowl and pour ghee on top to create smoke (cover and smoke for a minute). Remove the coal. and marinate the chicken pieces for another 20-30 minutes. 

3. Heat oil in a flat pan over moderate flame. Add the chicken pieces and cook for about 12 minutes or till little moisture remains. Turn the pieces frequently so that it cooks evenly.

Remove and serve hot with a salad and chutney of choice.

4. Enjoy!

name: Tawa Chicken
ingredients: Boneless chicken 500 gm,Chopped garlic 1.5 tbsp,Chopped ginger 1.5 tbsp,Salt 1 tsp (to taste),Red chili powder 1 tsp,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Garam masala 1 tsp,Green chili 4-5 pcs,Tomatoes 1 medium,Cilantro 1/4 cup,Unsalted butter 1 tbsp
instructions:
1. Clean and dice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.


2. In a bowl Mix chopped garlic, ginger , salt and lemon juice. Mix well and marinate for 15 min.


3. Heat oil in a pan over medium flame and fry the chicken pieces until light brown.


4. Add red chili, turmeric powder, garam masala and saute for 5-6  min.


5. Add green chili , tomatoes and coriander. Cover and cook until the chicken pieces are tender (approximately 12 min) 


6. Serve with mint chutney and paratha.


7. Enjoy!

name: Tandoori Chicken with Yellow Rice
ingredients: For Tandoori Chicken: Chicken thighs 1/2 kg,Plain yogurt 2 tbsp,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Onion paste 1 tbsp,Ginger paste 1 tsp,Red chili powder 1 tsp,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Garam masala 1 tsp,Salt to taste,Lime juice 1 tbsp,For Smoke: 1 piece of hot charcoal + 1 tbsp ghee,For Yellow Rice: Cooking oil/Butter 2 tbsp,Onion 1/4 cup,Green chili 4 pcs,Green bell pepper 1/4 cup,Red bell pepper 1/4 cup,Cumin powder 1 tsp,Turmeric powder 1 tsp,Chicken stock 3 cups,Soaked basmati rice 2 cups
instructions:
1. In a medium bowl, combine yogurt, garlic paste, ginger paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt and lime juice. Mix until smooth. 


2. Add chicken thighs to the bowl and spread yogurt mixture over chicken. 


3.  Take a piece of coal (about 3 inches big) and hold it over a gas flame with the help of tongs. The coal will begin to turn red hot and grey in about 5 minutes.  Place the hot coal inside a steel cup and return it to the chicken mixture. Pour a spoon of ghee on the coal and cover for 5 min.


4. Remove the coal and marinade the chicken for 1 hr.


 5. Cook chicken on grill until no longer pink and juices run clear. 




For yellow rice:


1. Heat 1 table spoon of cooking oil and butter in a pan.


2. Add onion 1/2 cup, green chili red, green and yellow bell pepper. And saute until the onions are translucent.


3. Add cumin powder, turmeric , salt and stir fry for few minutes.


4. Add 2 cups of soaked basmati rice and 1 table spoon of tomato paste.  stir until well mixed in 


5.  Pour chicken broth and raise heat to medium-high. Bring the mix to a boil then turn the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid.


6. Cook until the broth is totally absorbed. 


7. Remove from heat and add cilantro, and fluff with a fork. 


8. Enjoy !

name: Potol & Shrimp Malai Curry
ingredients: Cooking oil 1/4 cup,Pointed gourd (Potol) 7 pcs,Shrimp 7 pcs,Onion sliced 1/2 cup,Red chili powder 1/2 tsp,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Coriander powder 1/2 tsp,Ginger paste 1/2 tsp,Garlic paste 1/2 tsp,Salt to taste,Coconut milk 1 cup,Shredded coconut 1/4 cup,Green chili 6 pcs,Roasted cumin powder 1 tsp,Coriander leaves to garnish
instructions:
Wash, peel and score potol (gourd) into small pieces. Set aside in a bowl.  

Marinate the gourd pieces with a pinch of turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt as per taste. Coat all sides equally. Heat oil in a pan and fry the gourd pieces until it's slightly colored, 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside.  

Wash, peel and devein shrimps.   

Marinate the shrimp with a pinch of turmeric powder, red chilli powder and salt as per taste. Coat all sides equally. In the same pan, add some oil and fry them for 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside.   

In the same pan, add 1/4 cup cooking oil and sliced onions. Saute until they onions are translucent.   

Add ginger paste, garlic paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and saute the spices together. Stir continuously, add little water during sauteing to deglaze the pan.   

Once the oil separates and surfaces to the top, add salt to taste. Add ground coconut, stir and mix everything together. Add gourd pieces and continue to cook for 5 minutes. Continuously stir to prevent burning at the bottom of the pan, you can add some water to deglaze the pan.   

Add coconut milk, stir and mix everything together. Close lid and cook for 5 mins over medium heat, stirring occasionally.   

Add shrimp pieces, green chilli, roasted cumin powder and cook for another 5 mins.   

Garnish with coriander leaves before removing from heat.

name: Chepa Shutki Bhorta
ingredients: Chepa Shutki 6 pcs,Garlic chopped 1/2 cup,Onion chopped 2 cups,Green chili 6-8 pcs,Mustard oil 1 tbsp,Salt to taste
instructions:
Add oil to a non-stick fry pan, cook the shutki for 2-3 minutes on each side. Chepa shutki cooks very fast and can stick to the pan so make sure to use a non-stick fry pan. Remove onto a bowl, let it cool down.   

Add little oil to the heated pan and add chopped onions. Saute over medium flame until they turn lightly golden. Remove and set aside.  

Roast the green chilli and garlic on the same pan for 2 minutes, add little oil if needed. Stir and saute until they are slightly roasted. 

 

To make bhorta, you can use a blender, pester and morta or even a sheel pata. It's really down to what you feel is convenient and easy to use! All the elements of the dish is soft and can be used in either of the appliances. 

  

Grind the shutki with a little salt. The bones have soften as well so you can go ahead and include them as well.  

Add green chilli, chopped onions, sliced garlic and 1 tbsp of mustard oil. Grind them all together to make a pasty bhorta texture.   

If you want to make the bhorta less runny, use half the quantity of onions. You'll have a rough pasty texture. You can also alter other ingredients similarly to your liking.

name: Kosha Murgi
ingredients: Marinade: Chicken 1 kg,Plain yogurt 1/2 cup,Garlic paste 1.5 tbsp,Salt to taste,Cooking Ingredients: Cooking oil 6 tbsp (1/2 cup),Sugar 1.5 tsp,Red chili powder 1.5 tsp,Cardamom 4 pcs,Cinnamon 2 sticks,Fried onions (Beresta) 3/4 cup,Green chili 7-8 pcs
instructions:
In a bowl, add chicken pieces, plain yogurt, garlic paste and salt to taste. Mix all ingredients well and marinade the chicken for 45 minutes.  

Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat  

Add 1.5 tsp of sugar and continuously stir as the sugar dissolves and continues to cook. The sugar will begin to caramelize quickly.  

Mix red chilli powder in 2 tbsp of water in a separate bowl and add onto the pan. Stir the spices together continuously.   

Add the marinated chicken pieces, cardamom and cinnamon. Stir and mix everything together. Saute for couple minutes until the oil starts to surface to the top.  

Add 1/2 cup of fried onions (beresta) and mix everything well. Cover and cook for 15 mins over medium heat, stirring occasionally making sure nothing burns at the bottom. You can add little water to the chicken to deglaze the pan and avoid the meat from burning.  

Add another 1/4 cup of fried onions, green chillies and cook for another 5 mins. The gravy for this curry should be thick and not too runny. However, you can adjust the gravy consistency to your liking by adding more water, if needed.   

Once the chicken is cooked through, remove from heat.

name: Chicken Shami Kabab
ingredients: 2 cups water,400-gram boneless chicken,1 cup soaked split chickpeas,1 tsp ginger paste,1 tsp garlic paste,1 bay leaf,1 small cinnamon stick,2 cardamom,2 cloves,5 dry red chilies,1 tbsp coriander seeds,1 tsp cumin seeds,1 tsp salt,¼ cup fresh mint leaves,¼ cup fresh coriander leaves,4 chopped green chilies,¼ cup chopped onion,1 tsp lime juice,½ tsp garam masala,½ cup fried onion,2 eggs,1 tbsp cornstarch
instructions:
1. In a medium-size pot, add chicken, split chickpeas that have been soaked for 1-hour, ginger garlic paste, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cardamom, cloves, dry red chilies, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and salt 

2. Cook for 10 minutes with a lid on

3. Remove lid and stir and cook until water evaporates

4. Remove the bay leaf, cardamom, and cloves using a spoon

5. Add fresh mint, coriander, green chili, chopped onion, chicken mixture, garam masala, fried onion, and lime juice into a food processor 

6. Blend well 

7. Transfer to a bowl and add an egg and cornstarch or cornflour

8. Rub oil on your hand before mixing and shaping the kabab 

9. Whisk egg in a small bowl 

10. Coat the Shami kabab in whisked egg 

11. Transfer to a skillet to fry until golden brown 

12. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Tomato Fish Curry
ingredients: Fish (Mrigal) 1 lb,Onion sliced 1 cup,Garlic sliced 1/4 cup,Salt to taste,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Red chili powder 1 tsp,Coriander powder 1 tsp,Roasted cumin powder 1 tsp,Tomato cubed 1 lb,Water 4 cups,Lime juice 1 tbsp,Green chili 4-5 pcs,Coriander leaves to garnish
instructions:
Heat oil in a large pan, add sliced garlic and onions. Saute until the onions are translucent.  

Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, roasted cumin powder. Saute for couple minutes over high heat, add water as required.   

Add cubed tomato pieces and stir everything together. Cover and cook under medium heat, until the tomatoes have released water and are tender. Using a masher, mash the tomatoes into a puree.  

Add 4 cups of water, cover and cook until the gravy starts to simmer.  

Place fish into the sauce, cover and carefully simmer for about 10 mins. Give everything a stir occassionally  

Add lime juice, split green chilli and chopped coriander leaves.  

Once the fish is cooked, remove the pan from heat.

name: Lau Daal
ingredients: Lau 400 gm,Moong daal 1 cup,Onion sliced 1 tbsp,Garlic sliced 1 tbsp,Turmeric powder 1/4 tsp,Green chili 4 pcs,Salt to taste,Coriander leaves 1/4 cup,Tarqa: Paanch phoron 1 tsp,Mustard oil 4 tbsp,Onion 1/4 cup,Garlic sliced 1/8 cup (2 tbsp),Dry red chili 3 pcs
instructions:
Cooking Directions

  

Dry roast moong daal until it turns slightly brown. Remove from heat and let it cool.   

Soak in water for 30 mins. Rinse and set it aside.  

  

Heat a large saucepan at medium flame. Add soaked moong daal, sliced onions, sliced garlic, turmeric powder and salt. Add 4 cups of water, cook daal for 30 mins until it softens.  Boil longer if needed.  

Mash moong daal using a hand mixer.  

Add chopped lau / bottle gourd pieces and cook for another 15 mins until lau is tender.  

 

 

Tarqa

 

In a separate pan, add 3 tbsp mustard oil, 1/2 tsp panch phoron, sliced onions, garlic and dry red chilli. Fry until golden brown. Remove from heat and transfer everything onto the daal saucepan. 

 

Simmer daal for couple minutes, add coriander leaves and green chilli. 

Remove from heat and serve hot with rice.

 

 

Enjoy!

name: Fish Dopeyaji
ingredients: Rohu fish 5 pcs,Onion sliced 1 cup,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Red chili powder 3/4 tsp,Salt to taste,Tomato diced 1 cup,Water 1 cup,Roasted cumin powder 1/2 tsp
instructions:
Cooking Directions 

  

Wash, de-scale and clean the fish.    

Marinate fish pieces with 1 tbsp lime juice, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/4 tsp red chilli powder and salt as per taste. Coat all sides equally. Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish pieces until it's golden brown. While frying the fish, fry the skin-side first and then complete the remaining sides. Remove and set aside.  

In the same pan, prepare the gravy. Add onions and sauté at medium heat until they are translucent. Add salt while sautéing, it helps the onions to release water and cook faster.   

Add red chilli powder, turmeric powder and sauté for approximately 5 minutes. Add water as required. You should see the oil to start surfacing on the top.   

Add tomatoes and 1 cup water, continue to cook for another 5-10 minutes to form the gravy.   

Add the fish pieces and let it cook for 5 minutes. Flip the fish pieces in the gravy so all sides cook equally.   

Add roasted cumin powder. Let t simmer for couple minutes, then remove from heat. 

 

Serve hot with rice! Enjoy!

name: Chicken Papaya
ingredients: Green papaya 250 grams,Chicken legs 750 grams,Carrots 250 grams,Oil 1/4 cup,Onion sliced 1 cup,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Ginger paste 1 tsp,Red chili powder 1 tsp,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Coriander powder 1 tsp,Raw cumin powder 1/2 tsp,Roasted cumin powder 1/2 tsp,Garam masala powder 1/2 tsp,Cinnamon 2 sticks,Cloves 4 pcs,Bay leaves 2 pcs,Cardamom 4 pcs,Black peppercorns 8-10 pcs,Green chili 4 pcs,Salt to taste
instructions:
Wash, peel and cut green papaya in small 2-inch size pieces.   

Wash, peel and cut carrot in small pieces.  

Wash and clean chicken pieces. 

 

 

 

Directions

 

Heat oil in a pan over medium heat, add sliced onion and sauté until translucent. Add raw garam masala; black peppercorns, cardamom, cloves and bay leaves, along with chicken pieces. Stir and mix everything together with the spices. The caramelized onions will adds flavour into the chicken. Add red chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, raw cumin powder, garlic paste, ginger paste and salt to taste. Give everything a good mix and sauté over med-high heat for couple minutes. Add 1/2 cup water, close lid and cook for 5 mins over high heat (stir occasionally in between). Add green papaya, carrots and cook under closed lid again for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add 1 1/2 cup water, reduce heat to medium flame and cook for 20 mins under closed lid. 

Remove lid and check if the vegetables are cooked, if not, you can cook for another couple minutes. Add garam masala powder, roasted cumin powder, green chillies. Remove from heat.

name: Patishapta Pitha
ingredients: Pitha Batter: Rice flour 1 cup,Suji/Semolina 1/2 cup,White all-purpose flour 1/2 cup,Salt to taste,Water (warm) 2 1/2 cups,Pitha Filling: Evaporated milk 1 1/2 cups,Suji/Semolina 2 tbsp,Ghee 1 tbsp (optional),Gur/Jaggery 2 tbsp
instructions:
In a bowl, add rice flour, suji/samolina, white flour, salt. Mix all dry ingredients together. Add water in small amounts while whisking all ingredients together. Make sure there are no lumps in the batter.

Rest it for 15 minutes.

 

Heat a pan at medium flame, grease the bottom of the pan with oil. Add evaporated milk, suji (samolina), ghee, gur and mix all ingredients well. Continuously stir until the evaporate milk reduces and the mixture forms a thick paste. Remove the pan from heat and keep aside to be used as filling for the pitha. 

 

Heat a non stick pan (medium-high heat), grease the bottom with oil. Gently stir the batter and pour a spoonful of batter onto the centre of the pan. Slightly move/twist the pan so the batter distributes all sides making a round shape. Allow for one side to cook well (roughly 2 mins). Using a spoon, add the filling to one side and start rolling the pitha from one side until the end. Be careful as the pitha will be very hot! Remove pitha and grease the pan again before making next pitha. 

 

Serve hot or cold! Enjoy the sweetness!

name: Gajorer Halwa
ingredients: Carrot 4 cups,Milk 2 cups,Sugar 1/2 cup,Ghee 3 tbsp,Chana/Ricotta cheese 1 cup,Cardamom powder 1/2 tsp,Pistachio diced 1/2 cup
instructions:
Wash, peel and grate the carrots.

 

Add the grated carrots and milk in a heated pan. Bring the whole mixture to a boil in low medium flame. Allow the milk to simmer and reduce to almost 75%, add sugar and ghee. Stir well and continue to simmer at low flame, add chana/ricotta cheese. Mix all the ingredients well, add cardamom powder and sliced pistachio. Gently stir everything together, stir fry for couple minutes and remove the pan from heat.

 

Serve hot! Garnish with sliced pistachio or almonds.

name: Cauliflower Fritters
ingredients: Cauliflower (cut into florets) 1,Flour 1 cup,Chickpea flour 1 cup,Red chili powder 1.5 tbsp,Salt to taste,Baking soda 1/4 tsp,Ginger 1/2 tsp,Garlic 1/2 tsp
instructions:
1) Mix in flour, Chickpea Flour (Besan) , Red Chilli Powder, Salt , Ginger and Garlic in a bowl. Pour 1.5 cup of water required and whisk the batter to a smooth consistency. ( Don't make it too watery, add the water as required.)

3) Blanch the cauliflower in hot water for at least 2 minute. Drain the water and dry the cauliflower.

4) Dip them into the batter and deep fry in hot oil.

5) Serve warm.

name: Spinach Fritters
ingredients: Spinach 1 bunch,Green chili 2 pcs,Chickpea flour 1/2 cup,Red chili powder 1 tsp,Salt to taste,Baking soda 1 pinch,Onion 1/2 cup,Water 1/2 cup
instructions:
1) Mix in Chickpea Flour (Besan) , Red Chilli Powder, Salt , Onion, Green Chilli, Baking Soda  in a bowl. Pour 1.5 cup of water required and mix it well. ( Don't make it too watery, add the water as required.) 

3) Fry them in medium heat pan.

4) Serve warm.

name: Nargisi Kofta
ingredients: Eggs 4,1 cup ground mutton (keema),1 tsp chili flakes,Salt to taste,1 tsp garam masala,1/2 tsp ginger,Coating: White flour,Bread crumbs,Egg wash
instructions:
Boil the eggs and keep it aside.

 

In a bowl, add ground mutton, chilli flakes, garam masala, ginger and salt to taste. Mix all ingredients well.

Take small amounts of kabab mixture, flattened into your palm. Cover the egg fully with kabab mixture on all sides. Make sure the coating is equal on all sides. Similarly, coat all eggs with kabab mixture.

 

Coat the kababs with egg wash, followed by white flour and bread crumbs. Repeat same process for all kababs.

Keep it aside for 30 mins.

 

Deep fry the eggs in medium high heat oil. Cook all sides equally and it's golden brown.

 

Serve immediately! Enjoy!

name: Doi Bora
ingredients: Maskalai dal/Urad dal 1 cup (soaked for min 6 hours),Plain yogurt 2 cups,Salt,Roasted chili powder,Roasted cumin powder,Tamarind 1/2 cup,Sugar 2 tbsp,Black salt 1/4 tsp
instructions:
Soak Mashkalai daal / Urad dal  minimum 6hrs.  

Drain and blend it fine adding ginger , green chilli (add water as needed to blend)  

Once it blends well, beat well to make it lighter and fluffy (as shown in the video)  

Meanwhile, add 2tsp of salt in 4 cups of water  

Fry the dumpling/ boras in medium heat  

Soak the fried dumplings/bora immediately in the water mix for 15mins.  

Squeeze water gently out of  the dumplings/ bora and spread yogurt (blended with salt,roasted chilli, roasted cumin) over it. 

Garnish with roasted chilli powder, roasted cumin powder , tamarind chutney and some coriander leaves

name: Cabbage Fritters
ingredients: Cabbage sliced 1 1/2 cup,Rice flour 1/2 cup,White flour 1/4 cup,Green chili chopped 2 pcs,Onion sliced 1, Egg 1,Salt to taste,Water 1/4 cup
instructions:
In a bowl, add sliced cabbage with rice flour, white flour, chopped green chili, sliced onion, egg and salt to taste. Mix it well, add little amounts of water to make batter (approximately 1/4 cup).

 

Heat oil in a skillet at medium-high temperature. When the oil is hot, make small fritter balls and drop it in the hot oil. Be careful of hot oil! Fry until they are crisp and golden on both sides.

 

Remove to a paper towel, drain excess oil from fritters. Serve hot with tomato ketchup or any chutney of your choice!

 

Enjoy!!

name: Dudh Puli Pitha
ingredients: Filling: Ground coconut 1 cup,Melted jaggery/Gur 1/4 cup,Cinnamon 1 stick,Cardamom 3 pcs,Pitha Dough: Oil 1 tsp,Water 1 cup,Salt to taste,Rice flour 1 cup,Milk Ingredients: Milk 1 litre,Sugar 1/4 cup,Ground coconut 2 tbsp,Melted jaggery/Gur 1/4 cup
instructions:
On a heated pan, add ground coconut, melted jaggery/gur, cinnamon and cardamom. Stir and mix all ingredients together until the mixture becomes slightly sticky. Remove from heat and keep aside to be used as filling.

 

 

Add 1 tsp oil in a heated saucepan, add water and salt to taste. Let the water come to a boil and add rice flour. Close lid and reduce heat to low flame and let it cook for  5 minutes. After 5 minutes, stir the mixture to form a soft dough. Remove dough onto a plate and while the dough is still warm, knead well (allow it to cool slightly if it's too hot!). Adjust water and flour as required while kneading. Divide dough into small equal sized balls and roll them into thin round circles. You can also use a cutter to cut out round circles.

 

Add the coconut filling on one side in each pitha. Fold and twist the edges to close the pitha. Set aside. 

 

In a heated pan, add milk and sugar. Once the milk starts to boil, add the pithas. Add ground coconut and let the pithas cook for 10-15 minutes at medium-low heat. Stir gently so the milk does not burn at the bottom of the pan, careful to not break the pithas while stirring. Once the pithas are cooked, turn off the heat and add melted jaggery. Gently stir and mix it with the thickened milk. 

 

Serve warm or at room temperature. Enjoy!

name: Potato Egg Kabab
ingredients: Potatoes 2 (boiled and mashed),Eggs 2 (boiled),Onion 1 chopped,Black pepper 1/2 tsp (optional),Green chili 3 pcs,Coriander leaves 1/4 cup,Salt to taste,For Batter Mix: Plain flour 1/2 cup,Rice flour 1/4 cup,Red chili powder 1 tsp,Salt to taste,Water 1/4 cup
instructions:
1. In a bowl shred potatoes , eggs and mix it with chopped onion, green chilli , coriander and salt (black pepper optional.) Shape the mixture like a kabab or chop (as shown in the video).

 

2. Now for the batter mix , combine flour , rice flour , red chilli , a little beat of salt and water. 

 

3. Dip the kabab in the batter and shallow fry .

 

 

Enjoy!

name: Chicken Lollipop
ingredients: Chicken wings 5 pcs,Soy sauce 1 tbsp,Salt to taste,Black pepper 1 tsp,Ginger paste 1/2 tsp,Garlic paste 1/3 tsp,Batter: All-purpose flour 4 tbsp,Corn starch 2 tbsp,Red chili paste 2 tbsp,Paprika 1 tsp,Egg 1
instructions:
Lollipop chicken is best made with chicken wings. Using a sharp knife, make a cut all of the way around the leg just below the knuckle, cutting through the skins and tendons. Push the meat and shape them to balls on one side, place them all on a plate. Marinade the chicken pieces with soya sauce, black pepper, ginger, garlic paste and salt to taste. Leave it to marinade for 15-20 minutes.

 

 

In a bowl, add all purpose flour, corn starch, red chilli paste, Egg and paprika. Mix all ingredients well, add water as required (approximately 1/2 cup) to make the batter. Dip the chicken lollipop pieces into the batter gently to coat evenly.

 

 

Deep fry them in hot oil, at low medium flame for roughly 15 minutes. Serve hot with sauce!

name: Shrimp Pakora
ingredients: Shrimps 10 pcs,White bread 5 pcs,Onions finely chopped 1/4 cup,Green chili finely chopped 3 pcs,Garlic paste 1/2 tsp,Red chili powder 1/4 tsp,Roasted cumin powder 1/4 tsp,Coriander leaves 1/4 cup,Soy sauce 1 tsp,Salt to taste
instructions:
Rinse, clean and devein the shrimp by peeling the shell from it.   

Trim the edges of bread slices and cut it in small cubes. Transfer to a plate and keep aside. 

 

 

Cooking Directions

  

Cut shrimps into fine small pieces and transfer to a mixing bowl  

Add finely chopped onions, green chilli, red chilli powder, roasted cumin powder, minced garlic, soy sauce, chopped coriander leaves. Add salt as needed.   

Mix everything together and make small shrimp balls.   

Coat the shrimp balls with cubed white bread pieces. Using your hand, press from all corners and shape them into balls.   

Repeat same process for all shrimp balls.   

Place them on a plate and referigerate for 20 minutes, this will helps from falling apart during frying.  

  

Heat enough oil in a pan to deep fry at medium high heat.  

Check if oil is hot by dropping a small piece of dough, it should surface up to the top of the oil.   

Carefully drop the shrimp balls into the hot oil and fry for 2 mins in each side until golden brown.   

Remove and drain excess oil on paper towels.  

 

Serve hot and alongside sweet chilli sauce.

name: Fried Egg Sandwich
