ingredients: Chutney: Coriander leaves 1 cup,Mint leaves 1/4 cup,Garlic 1-2 cloves,Ginger 1 slice,Green chili 2 pcs,Roasted cumin powder 1/4 tsp,Sugar 1 tsp,Salt to taste,Lime juice 1 tbsp,Spicy Mashed Potato: Potatoes boiled 3-4 pcs,Coriander leaves chopped 1 tbsp,Green chili chopped 1 pc,Red chili powder 1/2 tsp,Salt to taste,Batter: Gram flour/Besan 1.5 cup,Garam masala 1/4 tsp,Red chili powder 1/4 tsp,Salt to taste,Water as required to make smooth batter,Slice bread 2 pcs,Hard boiled egg 1 sliced
instructions:
Chutney: 

In a blender add coriander leaves, mint leaves, garlic, ginger, green chilli, roasted cumin powder, sugar, salt and lime juice.   

Blend everything together to make chutney.   

Set aside 

 

Spicy Mashed Potato: 

Boil potatoes for 12-15 minutes over stove top. Mash them onto a bowl using a masher.   

Add chopped coriander leaves, chopped green chilli, red chilli powder and salt to taste. Stir and mix everything well.   

Set aside 

 

Besan batter: 

In a separate bowl take besan / gram flour, roasted garam masala, red chilli powder and salt to taste.   

Add water in small amounts, whisking together to form a smooth batter to dip the bread sandwich.  

 

Egg Sandwich: 

Boil an egg in a saucepan for 13 minutes until it is fully boiled. Slice the egg into thin slices.   

Take 2 slices of bread and apply a layer of chutney on one side of each bread. Add a layer of spicy mashed potato on top of chutney, add 2 slices of eggs. Place the second bread on top and pat it down.   

Heat 4 tbsp of oil in a frying pan over medium heat.   

Dip the sandwich into the besan batter on both sides, transfer onto the hot pan and fry the sandwich on both sides until golden brown.   

Remove onto a paper towel and drain excess oil.  

 

Serve hot alongside ketchup or chutney! Enjoy!

name: Deep Fried Masala Chicken
ingredients: Chicken legs 8 pcs,Lime juice 4 tbsp,Onion paste 2 tbsp,Ginger paste 1 tbsp,Garlic paste 1 tbsp,Salt to taste,Corn flour 2 tbsp,Gram flour 2 tbsp,Plain yogurt 3 tbsp,Garam masala 1 tsp,Red chili powder 1 tbsp,Black pepper 1/2 tsp,Cumin powder 1 tsp,Coriander powder 1 tsp,Chat masala 1 tbsp

name: Healthy Zucchini Chicken Soup
ingredients: Olive oil 2 tbsp,Onion sliced 1 cup,Garlic sliced 3 cloves,Zucchini 3,Chicken stock 2 cups,Water 2 cups,Salt to taste,Black pepper 1/2 tsp,Sour cream 1.5 tbsp,Parmesan cheese,Cooked shredded chicken 1 cup
instructions:
Dice the chicken into 1/2-1 inch bite size pieces. In a large stock pot over medium heat, pour 1 Tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the chicken and cook until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink, about 7-10 minutes. Take out of the pot and set aside.  

Add the 2 Tablespoon olive oil to a a cooking pot, keeping it at medium heat. Add the sliced onion , garlic and cook 5-6 minutes or until the onion is starting to get soft.  

Add in the chopped zucchini, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and cook about 20 minutes, stirring often, or until the zucchini are soft and tender.  

Add salt and black pepper  

Using a hand blender, puree the zucchini in the pot until it reaches a smooth consistency. stir and cook until heated through.  

Add sour cream and Parmesan cheese  

Serve hot with Parmesan cheese and crackers.  

  

Enjoy :)

name: Chicken Pakora
ingredients: Chicken thigh 1 cup,Lime juice 1 tbsp,Salt to taste,Garlic paste 1/2 tsp,Ginger paste 1/2 tsp,Garam masala 1/2 tsp,Paprika 1/2 tsp,Cayenne pepper 1/4 tsp,Gram flour 1/4 cup,Water 2 tbsp,Pinch of baking soda,Cooking oil to fry.
instructions:
1. Cut chicken into small cubes and add them to a bowl.

2. Mix lime juice, salt, ginger paste, garlic paste, paprika powder, garam masala, cayenne pepper, and 2 tablespoons of water in a bowl.

3. Now add the besan/gram flour and a pinch of baking soda to the bowl containing the chicken cubes and mix well.  

4. Heat the oil in a pan and fry the chicken cubes until they become golden brown. 

5. Serve hot with ketchup or mint chutney. 

6. Enjoy!

name: Aloor Singara
ingredients: Plain flour/Maida 2 cups,Salt 1/2 tsp,Cooking oil 5 tbsp,Cold water 1/2 cup,Boiled potato 3,Red chili 2 pcs,Panch Phoron 1 tsp,Coriander seeds 1 tsp,Green chili 3 pcs,Sliced ginger 1 tsp,Peanut 2 tbsp
instructions:
For Singara Dough:

1. In a large plate or a bowl take plain flour/maida, salt, 5 tablespoons of cooking oil.

2. Mix the flour with your hand till you get a breadcrumb-like consistency.

3. When you press a portion of the mixture, it should hold together and not crumble (as shown in the video).

4. Add cold water as required to make a smooth and tight dough (approx 1/2 cup).

5. Rest the dough for 30 min.


For the stuffing:

1. In a pan roast red chilies, panch phoron, coriander seeds and grind them using mortar and pestle.

2. Pound 1 teaspoon of ginger and green chili also using mortar and pestle

3. Heat 2 tablespoon of oil, add peanuts, green chili-ginger mix, chili panch phoron and coriander mix, a little bit of turmeric, half-boiled potato cubes, and salt to taste.


Frying Singara:

1. Heat oil over medium heat.

2. Turn over frequently and maintain low heat.

3.  Enjoy!

name: Potato Chicken Cutlets
ingredients: Shredded chicken 400 gm,Turmeric 1/2 tsp,Black pepper 1/2 tsp,Chicken boiled water to sauté,Boiled/mashed potatoes 2 medium size,Coriander,Salt,Red or green chili
instructions:
1. Add the boneless chicken , 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric , black pepper and salt in a pan and cook for 20 min.


2.  Remove the chicken, shred with two forks.


3.  In a large pan add 1 table spoon of cooking oil, 1/2 cup of chopped onion (saute until translucent), 1 tablespoon of ginger garlic paste. 


4. Return the shredded chicken, add 4 tbsp of  chicken boiled water , mashed boiled potatoes, cilantro and red chili . 


5. Remove from the stove and cool


 6. Whisk two eggs in one bowl. Pour bread crumbs in the second bowl. Dredge each cutlet in  the egg mix, then breadcrumbs.


7. Heat up cooking oil in a large pan. Fry the cutlets until they are golden brown.


8.Set cutlets on a paper towel to remove excess grease.


9. Serve with simple jeera rice or Biryani


Enjoy!

name: Crispy Egg Fingers
ingredients: Eggs 3,Salt to taste,Besan (gram flour) 4 tbsp,Red chili 1/2 tsp,Roasted cumin powder 1/2 tsp,Garlic powder 1/4 tsp,Ginger powder 1/4 tsp,Salt,Water as needed to make a smooth paste
instructions:
1. Beat the eggs well with salt and pepper. 

2. Steam for 8-10 minutes.

3. On a bowl mix all the ingredients , add water gradually to make a smooth paste.

4. Heat the oil. Dip each egg strips into the mixture and fry in the hot oil till golden brown on both sides. Drain well and serve immediately. 

5. Enjoy!

name: Biscuits
ingredients: ½ cup butter,¼ cup powdered sugar,1 cup wheat flour,½ tsp baking powder,¼ tsp baking soda,¼ tsp cardamom powder,3 ½ tbsp milk
instructions:
1. Mix butter with powdered sugar

2. Sift in wheat flour, baking soda, and baking powder

3. Add cardamom powder and a pinch of salt

4. Add milk and combine mixture but do not knead

5. Prepare round shape biscuits and place it on a baking sheet

6. Create a design using a fork

7. Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes at 160°C

8. To prepare the second type of biscuit, repeat step 1 and 2 but with ap flour and without the baking soda

9. Add desiccated coconut and milk

10. Repeat step 5 and 7 

11. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Nankhatai Cookies
ingredients: Plain flour 1 cup,Gram flour/besan 3 tbsp,Semolina/suji 3 tbsp,Baking powder 1 tsp,Cardamom powder 1/2 tsp,Pinch of salt,Ghee or butter 1/2 cup,Icing sugar 1/2 cup,Almond

name: Chicken Patties
ingredients: 1 chicken breast,½ tsp ginger,½ garlic clove,¼ tsp salt,1 cup of water,2 tbsp cooking oil,2 small onions,2 tbsp AP flour,¾ tsp pepper,¼ tsp salt,½ cup milk,2 puff pastry sheets
instructions:
1. Pour water in a pot, add whole chicken breast, ginger, garlic, and salt

2. Simmer until cooked on low-medium heat 

3. Remove chicken from heat and shred

4. Drizzle cooking oil in a pan, add chopped onions and cook until soft on medium heat

5. Add shredded boiled chicken and stir 

6. Add ap flour and fry for 2 minutes on medium heat

7. Add pepper, salt, and milk 

8. Stir well until milk is reduced

9. Brush oil on muffin baking pan

10. Place round cut out pastry sheets on baking pan 

11. Add the chicken filling, egg wash on the top edge, and seal the top with a layer of the round pastry sheet 

12. Brush egg wash on top 

13. Bake for 20 minutes until golden at 350 °F/ 176 °C

14. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken Chaap
ingredients: Chicken 250 gm,Plain yogurt 4 tbsp,Gram flour/besan 2 tbsp,Red chili powder 1 tsp,Cumin powder 1/2 tsp,Coriander powder 1 tsp,Nutmeg powder/jaifal 1/4 tsp,Black pepper 1/2 tsp,Tasting salt/msg 1/2 tsp,Chili flakes 1/2 tsp,Salt 1/2 tsp,Mustard paste 1 tsp,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Ginger paste 1/2 tsp,Mustard oil 1 tbsp,Vinegar 2 tbsp
instructions:
1.  Combine the chicken with all the marinade ingredients in a large bowl. Stir to make sure each piece of chicken is coated evenly, then cover with cling film and chill for about an hour. 

2.  Fry 3-4 pieces at a time until golden brown, flipping several times to ensure the chicken cooks evenly and does not burn. 

3.  Enjoy!

name: Dal Puri
ingredients: For Dough: All-purpose flour/maida 1 ½ cups,Salt ½ tsp,Cooking oil 2 tbsp,Water ½ cup room temperature,For Dal Filling: Onion 2 tbsp sliced,Garlic 1 tbsp sliced,Masoor Dal 1 cup,Water 1 cup,Turmeric ¼ tsp,Salt ½ tsp,Pepper ½ tsp,Chaat masala ½ tsp,Panch phoron ½ tsp roasted (Bengali five spices),Green chili 3 pcs chopped,Coriander 2 tbsp chopped
instructions:
1. Take a bowl and add all-purpose flour, salt, and oil. Add approx  ½  cup of room temperature water to make the dough (add 1 tbsp at a time). Once the dough is formed, rest it for 10 min. 

2. Take a pan and add oil, sliced onion, and garlic and saute them until soft. Add the dal and water, turmeric, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes or till the dal is slightly cooked. Add pepper, chaat masala, panch phoron, green chili. Now cook until all the water evaporates completely. Add chopped coriander.

3. Make small balls out of the dough and add a spoonful of the prepared mixture. Roll into puris. Heat oil in a pan over medium flame and deep fry the puris. Remove the excess oil and serve hot. 

4. Enjoy!

name: Chicken Momo
ingredients: Stuffing: 150 gm chicken,1 tsp soy sauce,¼ tsp salt,2 chopped green chilies,½ tsp ginger paste,½ tsp garlic paste,2 tbsp finely chopped onion,½ tsp cooking oil,½ tsp black pepper,Wrap: 1 cup all-purpose flour,¼ tsp salt,½ tsp oil,1/3 cup room temp. water
instructions:
1. Finely mince chicken using a food processor

2. In a bowl, mix chicken with soy sauce, salt, green chilies, ginger paste, garlic paste, onion, and cooking oil and set aside

3. In a bowl, mix flour with salt and oil then gradually add water until dough consistency then kneed

4. Add a splash of oil and allow the dough to set

5. Create small spherical shapes then flatten it with a pin roller until it has a 2.5-inch diameter

6. Add a generous amount of filling using a spoon then fold in half and gently seal the wrap using your fingers or a fork

7. Steam for 10-12 minutes

8. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Fish Fry
ingredients: Batter: ¼ cup gram flour,2 tbsp all-purpose flour,½ tsp red chili powder,¼ tsp turmeric,½ tsp coriander,½ tsp ginger paste,½ tsp garlic paste,¼ tsp salt,¼ cup water,½ tsp ground ajwain,1 tbsp lime juice,Fish: 1 ½ pound haddock fillet,Salt to taste,Lime juice,Water
instructions:
1. Prepare batter in a bowl by mixing in gram flour, ap flour chili powder, turmeric, coriander, ginger paste, garlic paste, salt, water, ajwain, and lime juice

2. Mix until a smooth consistency is achieved

3. Coat the fish fillet with salt, lime juice, and water

4. Then coat the fish fillet in batter 

5. Deep fry until golden brown

6. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Aloo Kabab
ingredients: 3 large russet potato,2 tbsp corn flour/cornstarch,¼ cup chopped tomato,2 chopped green chili,½ cup chopped onion,2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander,½ tsp coriander seeds,½ tsp cumin,½ tsp garam masala,½ tsp chili flakes,½ tsp red chili powder,¼ tsp ajwain,¼ tsp turmeric,½ tsp salt,2 egg,1 tbsp ghee
instructions:
1. Boil potato with salt 

2. Peel off the potato skin and mash using a potato masher

3. Add corn flour, green chili, onion, coriander seeds, fresh coriander, cumin, garam masala, chili flakes, red chili powder, ajwain, turmeric, salt

4. Whisk 2 eggs in a separate bowl with a pinch of salt

5. Scramble the egg on low heat

6. Transfer the scrambled egg to the mashed potato bowl 

7. Mix everything and create kabab shapes using your palm

8. Fry until golden brown 

9. Enjoy!

name: Potato Omelette
ingredients: 3 medium Russet potato,3 tbsp olive oil,¼ tsp salt,1 medium onion,5 eggs,Pepper to taste,2 tbsp chopped coriander,1 tsp red chili flakes
instructions:
1. Peel the potatoes and cut into thin slices then wash in water

2. Dry the potato with a towel and fry in a pan with salt and cooking oil for 2-3 minutes

3. Cooking for 2-3 minutes with lid on then add sliced onion and cook until soft

4. Crack open eggs in a clear bowl and add some salt and pepper to taste

5. Give it a whisk, add coriander, red chili flakes, fresh coriander and add the potatoes

6. Transfer the potato egg mixture back into the pan and cook on low-medium heat with lid on until golden brown

7. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Aloor Chop
ingredients: Inner Layer: 3 medium boiled potato,2 fresh chopped green chilies,2 tbsp fresh chopped coriander,1 tsp red chili flakes,½ tsp garam masala,½ tsp roasted cumin,½ tsp salt,1 tsp mustard oil,¼ tsp coarse ground coriander,2 tbsp corn starch,Outer Layer: 1 cup gram flour,½ tsp salt,½ tsp red chili,½ cup water approx.,1 tsp ginger and garlic paste,½ tsp baking soda
instructions:
1. Mash the boiled potatoes 

2. Mix in the chopped green chilies, coriander, red chili flakes, garam masala, roasted cumin, salt, mustard oil, coarse ground coriander and corn starch

3. Shape the kababs using your palm 

4. In a separate bowl, mix in gram flour with salt, red chili, and water until loose paste consistency 

5. Mix ginger garlic paste and baking soda to gram flour paste

6. Coat the potatoes in gram flour mixture and deep fry until golden brown 

7. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Shami Kabab
ingredients: Water 2 cups,Red meat mince 1/2 kg,Split chickpea 1 cup,Onion chopped 1/4 cup,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Ginger paste 1 tsp,Cumin seeds 1 tbsp,Coriander seeds 1 tbsp,Dry red chili 10 pcs,Garam masala 1 tbsp,Salt to taste,Onion chopped 1/4 cup,Green chili halved 5 pcs,Cilantro leaves 1/4 cup,Fried onions 1/4 cup,Egg 1,Hung curd (yogurt drained of all its water) 2 tbsp,Corn starch 2 tbsp
instructions:
In a large saucepan, add water, red meat, split chickpeas, chopped onions, garlic paste, ginger paste, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, dry red chilli, garam masala powder. Add salt to taste  

Cook under closed lid for 20 minutes, until the daal ( chickpeas) and meat is cooked through and all the water has evaporated. Remove from heat and set aside.  

In a food processor, add chopped onions, halved green chilli, coriander leaves and fried onions. Cover and pulse to grind everything. Add the ground meat mixture and grind again until it forms a fine pasty mixture.   

Remove into a bowl, add 1 egg, hung curd and corn starch. Mix everything well.   

Divide the mixture equally and shape each of them into round-flat patties.  

Heat oil in a pan. Break an egg in a separate bowl and lightly beat it using a fork or whisk. Dip the kabab patties in the egg wash and deep-fry them.  

Once they're brown on both sides, they are ready to be served. Remove and drain the excess oil on kitchen towels.

name: Aloo Pakora
ingredients: 3 boiled potatoes,1 medium onion,¾ tsp red chili,1 green chili,½ tsp ginger paste,½ tsp roasted cumin,¼ cup AP flour,¼ cup gram flour,2 tbsp fresh coriander,3-4 tbsp water,3 boiled potatoes,2 green chilies,2 tbsp fresh coriander,1 tsp red chili flakes,½ tsp garam masala,½ tsp roasted cumin,½ tsp salt,1 tsp mustard oil,½ tsp coarse coriander,2 tbsp cornstarch,1 cup gram flour,½ tsp salt,½ tsp red chili,½ cup water,½ tsp ginger garlic paste,½ tsp baking soda
instructions:
1. Mash the boiled potatoes

2. Add sliced onion, red chili, green chili, ginger, and salt to taste

3. Mix then add roasted cumin, ap flour, gram flour, and fresh coriander

4. Add a splash of water and mix well 

5. Deep fry the mixture until golden brown in low medium heat for 10-15 minutes

6. To prepare an alternative way, repeat step 1 

7. Add green chilies, fresh coriander, red chili flakes, garam masala, roasted cumin, salt, mustard oil, coarse coriander, and cornstarch

8. In a separate bowl, mix gram flour with salt, red chili, water, ginger garlic paste, and baking soda

9. Coat the potato mixture in gram flour then deep fry until golden brown 

10. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Dhakaiya Bhel Puri
ingredients: 2 cups soaked yellow peas,4 cups water,1 tsp salt,1 ½ cup AP flour,½ cup rice flour,¼ tsp salt,2 tbsp cooking oil,½ cup water + 2 tbsp water,3-4 dry red chili,1 ½ tbsp coriander,5 cardamom,1 cinnamon stick,1 tbsp cumin,¼ tsp nutmeg,½ tsp black salt,1 tsp salt,Yellow Peas Mixture: 2 cups cooked yellow peas,2 tbsp red onion,2 tbsp cucumber,1 tsp green chili,1 tbsp fresh coriander,1 tbsp spice mix,2 tbsp tomato,Garnish per puri: 1/2 tsp cucumber,1/2 tsp coriander,1/8 tsp roasted red chili,1 tbsp tamarind water
instructions:
1. Cook yellow peas in the water on medium heat until soft 

2. Prepare puri by mixing ap flour with rice flour, salt, cooking oil, and water 

3. Knead a tight dough and cover to rest 

4. Temper dry red chili, coriander, cardamom, cinnamon stick, cumin, and nutmeg

5. Blend the spices with black salt and regular sea salt 

6. Set aside the spice mix to use later

7. Roll out the dough into small flat round shapes 

8. Deep fry until it puffs up and turns golden brown 

9. In a small bowl, mix cooked yellow peas with chopped red onion, cucumber, green chili, fresh coriander, spice mix, and tomato

10. Crack open the top part of the fried puri and stuff the yellow peas mixture 

11. Garnish with cucumber, fresh coriander, roasted red chili, and tamarind water

12. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Malai Tikka
ingredients: 3 chicken breasts,1 ¼ tsp salt,1 tsp garlic paste,1 tsp ginger paste,¾ tsp pepper,¾ tsp chaat masala,1 tsp lime juice,3 tbsp plain yogurt,12 cashews,¼ cup fresh coriander,4 green chilies,3 tbsp water,2 tbsp cooking oil,1 tbsp butter,For Malai: 1 ½ tbsp butter,¼ cup cream,½ tsp chaat masala,¾ tsp pepper
instructions:
1. Cut chicken breasts into cubes

2. Marinate the chicken with salt, pepper, chaat masala, lime juice, plain yogurt, garlic, and ginger paste

3. Blend fresh coriander with cashews, green chilies, and water

4. Add the coriander puree to the chicken 

5. Marinate for 15 minutes 

6. Drizzle cooking oil, butter and add chicken pieces 

7. Cook for 8-10 minutes on medium heat

8. Grill for 3-4 seconds on direct flame

9. Using a separate pan, add butter and cream 

10. Bring to a boil and add the chicken pieces

11. Add chaat masala and pepper to taste

12. Continuously stir until sauce thickens and evaporates

13. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Binni Chaler Pitha
ingredients: 1 cup soaked rice,½ tsp salt,2 tbsp water,1 tbsp coconut,1 tbsp jaggery
instructions:
1. Blend rice 

2. Transfer rice to a bowl and add salt 

3. Gradually mix with water as it crumbles

4. Sift through a strainer to have finer bits 

5. Using a flat pan, put about two and a half tablespoons of rice 

6. Flatten into a round shape as it cooks 

7. Cover with lid for 30 seconds

8. Uncover and distribute coconut and jaggery on one half

9. Gently fold and serve 

10. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Jhal Mangsho Samosa
ingredients: Filling: 1 cup water,¼ tsp turmeric,½ tsp salt,600-gm lamb,3 tbsp cooking oil,1 medium onion,1 bay leaf,2 green chilies,1 tsp garlic paste,1 tsp ginger paste,¼ tsp salt,½ tsp coriander,¼ tsp turmeric,½ tsp red chili,1 tsp roasted cumin,½ tsp garam masala,2 tbsp water,Wrap: 1 ½ cup water,¼ tsp turmeric,¼ tsp salt,1 ½ cup rice flour
instructions:
1. Pour water in a pot and add turmeric, salt and lamb cuts

2. Cover with lid and cook until meat is tender

3. Remove from heat and shred the meat

4. Drizzle cooking oil in pan and add sliced onion, bay leaf, salt, garlic and ginger paste 

5. Splash of water to prevent burning

6. Add ground coriander, red chili, turmeric, roasted cumin and garam masala

7. Saute for 4-5 minutes on medium-high heat

8. Pour water as needed 

9. Add shredded lamb to pan 

10. Fry until dark brown on high heat

11. Remove from heat and let it cool

12.  Bring water to a boil in a large pot with salt and turmeric

13. stir in rice flour and turn off the heat

14. Cover with lid and rest pot for 5 minutes

15. Knead a smooth dough and cut into small pieces weighing 50 grams each

16. Roll out to flat sheets and place filling then seal

17. Fry in oil until light brown 

18. Ready to enjoy!

name: Crispy Eggplant Fry
ingredients: For Marination: 1 large "chubby" eggplant,½ tsp salt,½ tsp garlic paste,½ tsp ginger paste,½ tsp red chili powder,¼ tsp turmeric powder,1 tbsp cooking oil,1 tbsp chopped coriander,For Coating: ¼ cup suji/rawa/semolina,2¼ tbsp rice flour,½ tsp coriander powder,¼ tsp salt,For Frying: 1-2 tbsp cooking oil
instructions:
Prepare the Eggplant
Slice the Eggplant: Take a large, chubby eggplant and cut it into thin slices.

Score the Slices: Lightly score the surface of each slice to help the marinade penetrate.

Marinate the Eggplant
Prepare the Marinade: In a deep bowl, combine salt, garlic paste, ginger paste, red chili powder, turmeric, and cooking oil. Mix well.

Add Coriander: Add 1 tbsp of chopped coriander to the marinade and mix again.

Coat the Eggplant: Add the eggplant slices to the bowl and gently coat them with the marinade. Set aside.

Prepare the Coating
Mix Dry Ingredients: On a separate plate, mix suji/rawa/semolina, rice flour, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.

Fry the Eggplant
Coat the Slices: Take a marinated eggplant slice and coat it in the suji mixture. Shake off any excess.

Heat Oil: In a non-stick pan, add 1-2 tbsp of cooking oil and heat over medium heat.

Fry the Slices: Add the coated eggplant slices to the pan and fry for about 7 minutes, flipping them occasionally to ensure all sides are cooked well.

Serve
Serve the crispy eggplant fry with hot rice or as an appetizer.

name: Moong Pakon Pitha
ingredients: ½ cup moong dal,2 cups rice flour,1¾ cups sugar,1½ cups water,¼ tsp salt,Pinch of food color (optional),2 cardamom pods,Few drops of lime juice,Oil for frying
instructions:
Roast the Moong Dal: On a skillet, roast ½ cup of moong dal until fragrant over medium-low heat for 2-3 minutes.

Wash the Dal: Transfer to a bowl, wash exactly 2 times, and drain. (Washing more than twice may take away the flavor.)

Boil the Dal: In a pot with 4 cups of water, boil the dal with salt and food color (if using). Bring to a boil, then lower the heat, put a lid on the pot, and carefully simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Keep an eye on it; it may try to overflow, but use the lid to make sure you have enough water left for the next process.

Prepare Sugar Syrup: In a different pot, add sugar and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 4-5 minutes until a one-string consistency is achieved. Stop the heat and add cardamom and lime juice (to prevent crystallization).

Blend and Mix: Check the dal; it should be tender by now. Blend very well, add rice flour, and mix. Stop the heat and cover; rest for 10 minutes to cook the rice flour well.

Shape and Fry: Pour the mixture onto a flat surface and knead into smooth dough. Take small portions and cover the rest with a damp cloth. Roll out balls, apply oil, and design your favorite pattern. Fry over medium heat until golden brown.

Soak and Serve: Transfer fried pitha to sugar syrup and soak for 1-2 minutes. Take them out and serve.

name: Gurer Puli Pitha
ingredients: Wrap: 1 ½ cups AP flour,½ tsp salt,2 tbsp ghee,½ cup + 1 tbsp water,Filling: 200 gm shredded coconut,220 gm jaggery,¼ tsp cardamom

name: Doi Fuchka
ingredients: Puri Shells: 1 cup semolina,¼ tsp salt,1/3 cup water,Tamarind Sauce: ¾ cup tamarind,¼ tsp salt,½ tsp black salt,½ tsp dry red chili,½ tsp coriander,½ tsp cumin,1 tsp sugar,Doi Sauce: 1 cup 2% yogurt,¼ tsp black salt,1 tbsp sugar,Filling: 1 cup boiled yellow peas,1 small boiled potato,2 tbsp chopped onion,4-5 green chilies,½ tsp coriander,½ tsp cumin,¾ tsp dry red chili,2 tbsp tamarind sauce mix,3 tbsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1.       Knead a tight dough by mixing semolina with salt and water

2.       Cover the dough and let it rest for 10 minutes

3.       Cut dough in half and roll it out into a large round thin sheet

4.       Use a cookie cutter to cut out small round puri sheets

5.       Deep fry the puri sheets on medium low heat till fluffy and light brown in colour

6.       Set aside the puri shells

7.       Prepare tamarind sauce by mixing tamarind, salt, black salt, dry red chili, coriander, and cumin

8.       Mix in sugar to taste and set aside

9.       Prepare doi sauce by mixing yogurt with black salt and sugar and set aside 

10.   Prepare filling by mixing boiled yellow peas with crushed boiled potato, chopped onion, minced green chilies, coriander, cumin, dry red chili, tamarind sauce mix, and fresh coriander

11.   Crack the top part of the puri shell and place filling, tamarind, and doi

12.   Garnish with fresh coriander and dry red chili powder

13.   Ready to enjoy!

name: Tandoori Chicken
ingredients: Chicken 6 pcs,Plain yogurt 2 tbsp,Ginger paste 1 tsp,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Red chilli powder 1 1/2 tsp,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Salt to taste,Lemon juice 1 tsp,Charcoal 1 pc,Ghee 1 tsp
instructions:
Remove skin from chicken pieces, and cut slits into them lengthwise.

In a medium bowl, combine yogurt, garlic, ginger, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, lemon juice and salt to taste.  Spread yogurt mixture over chicken. Mix until smooth, set aside for 30 minutes.

Heat a grill pan, at medium high heat. Cook each side of the chicken for at least 20 minutes, until no longer pink and juices run clear.

 

After it's done cooking, remove chicken to a bowl.

To add tandoori flavor to the chicken, first take a piece of charcoal and put it over a gas flame with the help of tongs. The charcoal will begin to turn red hot and grey, this indicates that it's ready to be used for smoking. Place the hot coal inside a steel cup and pour 1 tsp of ghee on top of the coal. It will being to smoke, immediately cover the bowl with lid and allow for the chicken to have a smoked tandoori flavor. After 1.5 minutes, remove lid.

 

Serve hot! Enjoy!

name: Green Mango Dal
ingredients: For Dal: Lentils 1 cup,Garlic sliced 3 cloves,Onion sliced 1,Green chilli 3 pcs,Salt,Water 5 cups,Turmeric 1/2 tsp,Bay leaf 2 pcs,Green mango 1,For Tarka: Garlic sliced 3 cloves,Onion sliced 1,Dry red chilli 2 pcs,Panch Phoron 1/2 tsp (optional)
instructions:
1. Combine washed lentils, garlic , onion , green chili, salt  and  water in a large saucepan. Add turmeric and bring to a boil (approx 10 min). Reduce heat to a simmer and blend it a little bit to make it soft. Then add bay leaves and green mango . Cook for another 5 min  

2. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, dry red chilli, panch phoron(optional) and cook until fragrant and starting to brown.  

3. Take this mixture and carefully add to the cooked lentils. Stir well.

name: Kolija Bhuna
ingredients: Oil 1/2 cup,Raw cumin 1/2 tsp,Potato 2 medium,Liver 1 lb,Cardamom 4 pcs,Cinnamon sticks 2 pcs,Cloves 4 pcs,Bay leaf 2 pcs,Whole black pepper 7 pcs,Salt to taste,Red chilli powder 1 tsp,Turmeric powder 1/2 tsp,Coriander powder 1/2 tsp,Onion sliced 1 medium,Garlic paste 1 tsp,Ginger paste 1 tsp,Green chilli 4 pcs,Roasted cumin powder 1/2 tsp
instructions:
1. Pour water in a large saucepan and heat it at medium high flame. Add raw liver once the water comes to a boil and stir it well for 1 min. This process will wash the liver in hot boiling water. Remove liver onto a bowl and leave it aside.  

2. Add oil in a large pan at medium high flame. Once its hot, add raw cumin and potatoes. Mix the potatoes with salt and 1/4 tsp of turmeric powder. Fry the potatoes until they are golden brown. Remove potatoes in a bowl and leave it aside. Add more oil to the pan and add onions. Sauté onions until translucent, add garlic, ginger, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and coriander powder. Mix all ingredients together and sauté for couple mins at medium high heat. Add water as required during sautéing. Add liver and salt to taste. Stir and mix the liver with all spices well. Add water as required and cook for 10 mins under closed lid, stirring occasionally in between. Add fried potatoes and cook again for another 10 minutes. You'll see the water reduced and meat cooked with oil surfacing to the top. Add roasted cumin powder and garnish with green chilli.   

3. Remove from heat and serve hot! Enjoy!

name: Dharosh Bhaji
ingredients: Okra 1 lb,Onion sliced 1,Garlic sliced 4 cloves,Green chilli chopped 3 pcs,Turmeric powder 1/4 tsp,Salt to taste
instructions:
1. Wash okra and cut the head and tail off each. Chop okra into small pieces.

 

2. Heat oil in a pan at medium-high heat. Add onions, garlic, green chilli and saute for couple minutes. Add okra pieces, turmeric powder and salt to taste. Cook for 10 minutes while continuously stirring. Okra tends to be sticky, keep stirring so it does not stick to the pan and burn. Add water as required.

 

3. Serve hot! Best served with rice or bread.

name: Vegetable Pulao
ingredients: Potato 1/4 cup,Cauliflower 1/4 cup,Carrot 1/4 cup,Salt to taste,Green beans,Green peas 1/4 cup,Basmati rice 2 cups,Hot water 3 cups,Milk 1 cup,Bay leaves 2 pcs,Cinnamon 2 pcs,Cardamom 3 pcs,Cloves 3 pcs,Mace 1,Shah jeera/Black cumin 1/2 tsp,Onions 1/2 cup,Ginger paste 1/2 tsp,Garlic paste 1/2 tsp,Green chilli sliced 7-8 pcs,Ghee 1 tbsp
instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, drain the rice and keep aside.


2. Wash and cut all veggies into small pieces.

3. Heat oil in a wok, add potatoes and carrots. Add salt as required and saute until the potatoes are half cooked. Add remaining veggies and saute again for 2 minutes. Remove from pan and keep aside.

 

4. Heat oil in the pan, add shah jeera, bay leaves, cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, mace and sauté the garam masala till they crackle. Add onions and sauté until they are translucent. Add ginger and garlic paste, stir and sauté everything together. Add hot water and milk, cover with lid and cook until the water comes to a boil. Add soaked rice, gently stir and cover with lid and continue to cook the rice until it's 75% done. Add green chilli, fried onion, mint, corriander and ghee and cover it . Cook for 10 min at dome.

name: Kala Bhuna
ingredients: 3 tbsp cooking oil,2 kg red meat,1 ½ tsp salt,1 ½ tsp coriander,1 ½ tsp red chili,1 tsp turmeric,1 cup onion,1 tbsp garlic paste,1 tbsp ginger paste,4 green chilies,5 cardamom,7 cloves,8-10 black pepper,3 cinnamon sticks,2 bay leaves,¼ tsp mace powder,½ cup yogurt,1 tsp sugar,2 tbsp fried onions,2 tbsp mustard oil,¼ cup onion,4-5 green chili,½ tsp garam masala
instructions:
1. In a large pot, add cooking oil, red meat, salt, coriander, red chili, turmeric, onion and stir for a couple of minutes

2. Mix in garlic paste, ginger paste, green chilies, cardamom, cloves, black pepper, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, mace powder, yogurt, sugar, and fried onions

3. Cook for 1 hour and 45 minutes on low heat with the lid on

4. Stir occasionally 

5. Using a large pan stir fry onion and green chili in mustard oil

6. Transfer the meat to the pan and continuously stir

7. Add garam masala and mix before serving

8. Ready to Enjoy!

name: Chicken Jalfrezi
ingredients: Chicken Prep: 1 kg chicken,¾ tsp turmeric,1 tsp red chili,1 tsp salt,1 tbsp cooking oil ,Jalfrezi: 3 tbsp cooking oil,1 cup onion,4-5 garlic cloves,1 ½ tsp cumin,1 ½ tsp coriander,1 cup tomato,1 tbsp ginger,4 tsp ketchup,1 tbsp butter,1 lime juice,1 tbsp fresh coriander
instructions:
1. In a clear bowl, mix curry cut chicken pieces with turmeric, salt, red chili, and cooking oil

2. Marinate for 30 minutes or more

3. In a pan, add cooking oil along with thinly sliced onion, sliced garlic, pinch of salt, and the marinated chicken pieces 

4. Saute for 8 minutes on high heat

5. Add cumin and coriander

6. Saute for another 5 minutes on medium-high heat

7. Stir in chopped tomato, sliced ginger, and ketchup

8. Pour hot water

9. Cook for 25 minutes on low heat with lid on

10. Stir occasionally 

11. Finish off with butter, lime juice and some fresh coriander

name: Kolmi Shak Bhaji
ingredients: Water Spinach-400 g,Onion-1 medium,Garlic-few cloves (as per taste),Dry red chili-as per taste,Green chili-as per taste,Salt-as required,Oil-as required
instructions:
1. Discard the bottom part of the leaves, and keep the top until first two nodes. Wash all leaves, thoroughly with cold water, discard old parts.

2. Chop leaves roughly.

3. In a pan, heat oil and add dried red chili, sliced onion and garlic. Fry them until onion garlic are golden brown.

4. Add chopped leaves and continue to stir them until shrunk.

5. When all leaves gets smaller volume, add salt.

6. Add green chilis when leaves releases water. Continue stirring until water get evaporated and oils get released in the pan. When done, put in a serving bowl.

name: Duck Curry With Coconut Milk
ingredients: 1 kg Duck meat,1 cup Coconut milk,1 tsp each Ginger-garlic pastes,1 tsp Cumin powder,1 tsp Coriander powder,1 tbsp Red chili powder,1 tsp Turmeric powder,1/2 cup Chopped onion,1 pc Bay leaf,2 pcs Cloves,1/2 tsp Cinnamon powder,1/2 tsp Cardamom powder,3 tbsp Vegetable/soybean oil,1 tsp Roasted cumin powder,To taste Salt,1/2 tsp Roasted cinnamon powder,1/2 tsp Roasted cardamom powder
instructions:
1. Cut the meat into small pieces, wash and drain properly.

2. Now heat oil in a pan. Add chopped onions, bay leaves, cloves and cook for a minute to make onions tender. No need to fry onions to brown. Add garlic and ginger pastes and stir for a while. Now add cumin powder, red chili powder, coriander powder and some water. Mix and cook well till the spices release oil. Now add meat pieces and mix them properly. No need to add water in this stage since meat releases water. Cook for 5 minutes.

3. When the spices mix gets thick and oil separates, add water and cover with the lid. Cook for 10-15 minutes. You can add extra water in this stage and cook for extra 5 minutes if the meat is still hard. When water is reduced to half, add turmeric powder and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.

4. Then add 1 cup coconut milk and water as per your gravy requirement and cook with the lid for about 15 to 20 minutes. When the gravy is dried to your requirement, add cardamom, cinnamon powder. Cook for another 5 minutes. Then turn the flame off, sprinkle roasted spice powders and leave it for 2 minutes. Now serve warm with plain or pulao/pilaf rice, roti, paratha or naan bread.
